The more powerful cards for one is a weaker card for the other. Players may take on aggressive or defensive strategies while building their decks. The game concludes as one player opens the gates to Hell or the other banishes them to the darkness.

149639.description:
Noble Treachery: The Last Alliance is a card and dice game fusion: form alliances, test the fates, declare war, invoke diplomacy, poison enemies and claim the throne. Each card has a power and an ability that is affected by the value of die that matches the color of the card i.e. the dice affect the cards and the cards may change the dice.

The game is typically played with 4 to 6 players (there are several game variants including a 3 player version on our “Game Variants” page). Game time is approximately 1 hour.

Noble Treachery is a "casual" game designed for players that enjoy changing strategy on the fly. Your best laid plans will be foiled by your opponents (you can always count on your friends to mess up your master plan), so always have a back-up plan and a back-up plan for that plan!

From the back of the box:
The time of peace and prosperity for the Kingdom of Black Rose has ended with the untimely and mysterious death of the king. With no heir, it is now up to the five great noble houses to choose a successor to the throne. Only the most cunning and treacherous player will be able to unify the five noble houses and ascend to the throne.

Noble Treachery is a card and dice game for 4 to 6 players where players risk their tenuous political alliances during the chaos of war or the treachery of diplomacy to form new alliances with the noble houses of Black Rose. The first player to form an alliance with each of the noble houses becomes the King or Queen of Black Rose and wins the game. Players utilize armies, knights, nobles, clerics, spies, castles, witches, thieves, mages and poison in an ever-changing quest to win the support of the noble houses.

Noble Treachery is about thrills, love of the chase, close finishes, moments of shock and comeback victories.
149639.name: Noble Treachery: The Last Alliance

149640.description:
Infamy: Corruption is a 6-card mini expansion for Mercury Games' Infamy.

It contains 3 new Mission Cards and 3 New Scheme Cards, one for each faction in the game.
149640.name: Infamy: Corruption Mini-Expansion

149641.description:
The Triggerman Mini-Expansion is the second small expansion for Mercury Games' Infamy.

It contains 6 new Mission Cards, one for each sector in Infamy.
149641.name: Infamy: Triggerman Mini-Expansion

149642.name: Deepest Shadow
149642.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

House Moonstar asks adventurers to reveal traitors and discover secrets in a most perilous place. A two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Waterdeep for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). This adventure continues the Brightcloaks Major Quest and should be played after WATE3-1 and immediately before WATE3-3. We recommend you allow at least eight hours of play time to complete this adventure.

149643.name: Dragon (Issue 428 - Oct 2013)
149643.description:
Contents

3 Scary Stuff by Steve Winter
Getting scared is a kick, even when it's all for pretend.

4 Backdrop: Westgate by Erik Scott de Bie
The city of Westgate is brimming with opportunity—for those who can handle the risk.

13 Court of Stars: The Wild Hunt by Aaron Infante-Levy
The Horned Lord was adopted into the Green Court, but he was destined to fall from favor.

17 Fright Night by Steve Winter
So what if heroic characters have icewater in their veins? Your goal is to spook players.

23 Channel Divinity: Amon the Wolf by Tim Eagon
Amon the Wolf terrorizes Avernus and other planes in his quest for vengeance against the enemies of his lord, Levistus.

28 Bazaar of the Bizarre: Treasures from the Far Realm by Eytan Bernstein
A magic item crafted in the Far Realm may be useful in mortal hands, but never let one fool you into thinking it's your friend.

32 Rumor Has It by Skip Williams
You'll never be at a loss for local events and rumors if you keep this list nearby.

38 The Speaking Skill of Themraver Hall by Ed Greenwood
In the gloomy, rotten-floored Themtraver Hall dwells the Speaking Skull.

149644.name: Ark of Time
149644.description:
From the back of the box:

In his quest to find a missing professor, journalist Richard Kendall travels to the Rum Cay Islands. There, a fabulous adventure aware him. The unsuspecting journalist is taken to several famous and mysterious places like Stonehenge, Easter Island and Ahaggar. He might even discover Atlantis!

149645.name: Olympus Mons (1st Edition)
149645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Olympus Mons is a universe book for Stellar Wind and provides a setting GMs can use to give flavor to their campaigns.

With a touch of Ayn Rand, a touch of Heinlein and a slightly larger touch of Poul Anderson as inspiration, Olympus Mons is set in a time when the solar system is settled; great fusion-powered "scoop ships" travel back and forth between the stars; and a powerful, wealthy, terraformed Mars is the center of human civilization.

Olympus Mons includes the following:

A detailed future history to give your adventures a rich back story
Descriptions of a new type of human: the Martian
Information on the government of the Solar system
New technology specific to the setting
Institutions
Economics and trade
Rules on the honorable practice of the Martian duel
Descriptions of culture and society
Descriptions of the inhabited worlds of the solar system
Descriptions of humanity's current extrasolar colony worlds




Be aware that Olympus Mons is a setting for GMs who want their SF particularly hard. It does not include alien races or faster than light space travel.

149646.name: Character Builder (1st Edition)
149646.description:
From publisher blurb:

Character Builder is a Stellar Wind Player’s Aid. Player’s Aids are small works that provide useful tools for both GMs and players.

This aid consists of three spreadsheets that will automatically generate an NPC of any Race and Background. One sheet is in Excel format for Windows users who have Excel 2007 or later, one is in Numbers for iPad format, and one is in Numbers format for Mac users who have iWork 09 or later. The iPad and Mac spreadsheets will fill out a character record sheet for you when generating the NPC.

Included is a readme file giving instructions and tips on using the spreadsheets.

149647.name: Forms & Records (1st Edition)
149647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forms & Records is a Stellar Wind Player’s Aid book. Player’s Aid books are small works that provide useful aids for both GMs and players.

In this book you will find blank forms for recording character information, personal inventory (money, weapons, equipment, etc.), spacecraft data, star system data and planetary data. You will also find an area map template you can use when you want to draw maps of specific hexes on your planetary data map.

149648.name: Spacecraft Builder (1st Edition)
149648.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spacecraft Builder is a Stellar Wind Player’s Aid. Player’s Aids are small works that provide useful tools for both GMs and players.

This aid consists of two spreadsheets that do all the heavy lifting for you when building spacecraft. One in Excel format for Windows users who have Excel 2007 or later and one in Numbers format for Mac users who have iWork 09 or later.

The Excel spreadsheet has basic formatting and performs all the required calculations for size, cost, downpayment, etc. based on your selections. You can then use the final information to fill out your Spacecraft Data Record sheet.

The Numbers version fills out a Spacecraft Data Record for you as you work through the spreadsheet. When finished, you can copy and paste the resulting data record into Preview for printing.

The Numbers version WILL work on an iPad (if you have Numbers for the iPad) with some reduction in the spreadsheet functionality, but the data record sheets WILL get filled out. If you are a Windows user, simply email the Numbers file to yourself and open it on the iPad, then tap the icon in the upper right corner of your iPad screen and choose to open the attachment in Numbers.

149649.name: Resumes & Rapsheets, Volume 1 (1st Edition)
149649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Resumes and Rapsheets is a Stellar Wind Player’s Aid. Player’s Aids are small works that provide useful tools for both GMs and players.

This aid consists of ten notable NPCs for use in your Stellar Wind game, four of whom are characters from the core rules short story: Nathaniel Gregory, thief-for-hire; Spider, cybernetically-enhanced information broker; Orla Devors, stunningly beautiful and deadly goods-man; and Sen-Lin-Ban-Dren-Mon, insane Skelkess collector of rare antiquities.

Each NPC includes a portrait, complete stats, skills and skill levels, a short psychological and physical profile, and a complete description detailing mannerisms, interesting facts and where the NPC is typically encountered.

149650.name: Stellar Wind Core Rules: 2nd Edition
149650.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Second Edition of the Stellar Wind core rules. The second edition takes everything that was great in the first edition and makes it better. In the second edition you'll get:

A clean, rich layout optimized for tablet viewing, but that still looks great in print.
All new interior art, including high-quality re-imaginings of the character races.
A brand new Stellar Wind story that weaves through the book, introducing each chapter.
Simplified character generation that gives you complete control over your starting skills.
Simplified rules for poison, disease and radiation.
Streamlined combat rules.
Greatly simplified space travel rules, making space travel easier to play, while still preserving the unique realism the game is famous for.
Reorganized and streamlined spacecraft design rules that simplify building space ships for your game, while still giving you the most realistic spacecraft you'll find outside of NASA.
Updated world generation rules that greatly expand the variety of worlds you can create.
Two new appendices, showing alien races to scale, and grouping together commonly used tables for easy GM and player reference.
High-quality 1920x1080 versions of the character race and character background portraits.




In addition to the new material, all that was great about the first edition is still there, from rules on crewing spacecraft, to rules on how to handle solar proton storms. We've also left in the advanced rules appendix for those gamers who love crunch and eating natural logarithms for breakfast.

149651.name: Character Builder
149651.description:
From publisher blurb:

Character Builder is a Stellar Wind Player’s Aid. Player’s Aids are small works that provide useful tools for both GMs and players.

This aid consists of three spreadsheets that will automatically generate an NPC of any Race and Background. One sheet is in Excel format for Windows users who have Excel 2010 or later, one is in Numbers for iPad format, and one is in Numbers format for Mac users who have iWork 09 or later. The iPad and Mac spreadsheets will fill out a character record sheet for you when generating the NPC. Download the spreadsheet that fits your needs. The Excel spreadsheet is compatible with Libre Office 4 and later.

Included is a readme file giving instructions and tips on using the spreadsheets.

149652.name: Forms & Records
149652.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forms & Records is a Stellar Wind Player’s Aid book. Player’s Aid books are small works that provide useful aids for both GMs and players.

In this book you will find blank forms for recording character information, personal inventory (money, weapons, equipment, etc.), spacecraft data, star system data and planetary data. You will also find an area map template you can use when you want to draw maps of specific hexes on your planetary data map. All forms in the book have been updated to be compatible with the second edition rules.

149653.name: SpaceCraft Builder
149653.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spacecraft Builder is a Stellar Wind Player’s Aid. Player’s Aids are small works that provide useful tools for both GMs and players.

This aid consists of two spreadsheets that do all the heavy lifting for you when building spacecraft for the second edition rules. One spreadsheet is in Excel format for Windows users who have Excel 2007 or later and the other is in Numbers format for Mac users who have iWork 09 or later.

The Excel spreadsheet has basic formatting and performs all the required calculations for size, cost, downpayment, etc. based on your selections. You can then use the final information to fill out your Spacecraft Data Record sheet.

The Numbers version fills out a Spacecraft Data Record for you as you work through the spreadsheet. When finished, you can copy and paste the resulting data record into Preview for printing.

The Numbers version WILL NOT work on Numbers for iOS.

149654.name: Godling Tech: Volume 1
149654.description:
From publisher blurb:

The godlings. Thousands of years ago the universe was their playground. Their technology is a mystery (some would say magical). They are gone, but their toys and their tools and their terrors remain. Waiting to grant riches. Or death. Will you seek for them?

Godling Tech is a Stellar Wind supplement that provides 23 pieces of godling technology GMs can introduce into their universe. The book also includes a history of the godlings and guidelines on how GMs can introduce godling artifacts into their game.

149655.name: Path of Undeath
149655.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the next installment of our Adventure Path Iconics line, and the seven characters herein are specifically designed for play in the Obsidian Apocalypse campaign setting and the gothic and horror-themed Adventure Path. Each character has a full stat block, including campaign traits, a detailed background and personality, and advice on advancement through 4th level. Find one that suits you and you’re ready to play. These characters have been built using a 20-point buy, as many Pathfinder players and GMs prefer it. However, each comes with instructions on how to adjust the stats to a 15-point buy, should your GM wish to use the standard for Paizo’s adventure paths. If your group enjoys an epic fantasy feel for their characters, then adjustments up to a 25-point buy are also available. Whatever your style of play, just a few minor tweaks will have you ready to go.

The iconic consist of seven unique races from the Obsidian Apocalypse campaign setting such as:

Exalted: The exalted are the direct offspring of angelic outsiders mated with the humans of Abaddon. The unique circumstances of Abaddon make this pairing a more common event than it might be in other parts of the multiverse. The angels here are thrust into closer contact with mortals than they are used to, cut off from the gods and entities that they serve and forced to make new lives for themselves.
Genesai: Genesai are the result of demonic outsiders mating with angelic outsiders, defying all that both sides of the eternal conflict between good and evil consider inviolate. In other worlds and planes of existence, this pairing might be all but unthinkable, but the nature of Abaddon as a “planar trap” throws these opposites together far more often than elsewhere. Whatever the agents of good and evil have against reach other, as outsiders they at least share the same origin.
Harrowed: The harrowed are one of the most despised and feared races of Abaddon. They are no less than the result of the unholy and abominable union between mortal humanoids and the foul undead. To the subjugated populace, the very existence of the harrowed is a constant reminder of their undead overlords who have taken over Abaddon. These creatures are royal bastards, neither fully mortal nor fully undead, caught between the two worlds.
Infernals: Infernals are the offspring of demonic outsiders and humanity upon Abaddon or the result of a tainted bloodline throwing up a child bearing the mark of past transgressions of natural law. Infernals are relatively common on Abaddon, given the nature of the world as a “planar trap” and the natural proclivities of the demons who find themselves here, as they are trapped, frustrated, and have only a few playthings to assuage their boredom.
Khymer: The khymer are descendants of those killed, or at least physically destroyed, by the meteor that struck Abaddon. The necromantic radiation emanating from the blast had many long-lasting effects on Abaddon and its people. For the inhabitants of one city, though, it meant liquefaction followed by mingling with the ravening light. This process infused the liquid remains with negative energy, which coupled with the latent remnants of that people’s native psionic abilities.
Lykian: Abaddon’s werewolf lycanthropes, most commonly called lykians, are one of the most unusual residents of the world. Unlike standard lycanthropes, lykians are born as lycanthropes. They do not suffer from the lycanthropic disease; instead, they are considered a separate humanoid race with the shapechanger subtype. Before the apocalypse, many carried the curse of lycanthropy, but due to unknown, powerful forces of magic, the curse took on a new form from which the lykians have evolved directly. Lykians, unlike lycanthropes, have only one physical form, despite their shapechanger subtype. They are considered by many to be extremely bestial, hostile, and brutish, like their canine lineage. Their primal nature often usurps and controls their cognitive and reasoning abilities.
Osirian: According to ancient lore, the osirians were the first intelligent species to emerge on Abaddon, chosen by the gods to be their first creation on this world. They were, and are, a regal and proficient people famed for their skill with their hands and their swiftness, as dangerous archers and fencers and makers of technical wonders and fine crafts.




These iconic consist of:

Ilita Faara, Female khymer psychic warrior
Mik’quol an-str-natk, Male osirian cleric (Zebediah)
Mouse, Female genesai rogue
Setiphet Sir Lykash, Female harrowed fighter
(Treeshearer) Snarltooth Swifttongue, Female lykian ranger
Xasturian, Male infernal sorcerer
Yeremil Al Zebediah, Male exalted monk

172209.name: Zombie Apocalypse Geocaching: Exclusive Kickstarter Pack

149656.description:
The Zombie Apocalypse has begun!

Fortunately, YOU have your priorities straight. What could be more important? It’s time to grab your shotgun and go out Geocaching!
The Zombie Apocalypse Geocaching expansion pack adds an incredible amount of fun, twists, and strategy to Cache Me If You! Nothing puts a thrill into geocaching like running down a few Zombies along the way. A Zombie or two won’t be much of a problem, but watch out when they start to gather and overwhelm. And if they get to you, you will play out the game as a geocaching Player Zombie!
The expansion pack includes all of your favorite items… shotguns, chainsaws, crowbars and more!
A New Zombie Hunting Character
Specialized Equipment Cards
Additional Event Cards
Even More Caching Area Cards
The Zombies will be moving and gathering their numbers… Geocaching will never be the same!
149656.name: Zombie Apocalypse Geocaching

149657.name: Beneath the Stones
149657.description:
From publisher blurb:

After a disastrous encounter with a goblin warband the fleeing survivors find themselves trapped in and among the fog enshrouded standing stones of Selith Azard, surrounded on all sides by murderous goblins.

Providence gives the adventurers a way out - a secret entrance into a hidden lair is exposed during the fighting. Escape into the unknown below seems to be their only chance at survival.

Can the party survive agains the odds, trapped between the pursuing goblins and the horrors that lie beneath the stones. For Selith Azard has a grim reputation. The local people avoid it, claiming it is haunted or the den of some foul monster. Regardless of the truth, no-one ever returns from there.

Beneath the Stones is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for four 1st level characters using the Medium XP advancement track.

This adventure can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world.

Upon completing the adventure the characters should attain 2nd level.

149658.name: Fight for Freedom
149658.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party wake up from their camp one morning to find that they have been captured by a strange demiplane, they must use all their resources to escape. Not only is the demiplane filled with deadly construct and undead guardians, but the characters are not the only creature’s trapped there. At the far end of the complex an ancient evil awaits. Imprisoned by an act of cowardice and betrayal, the prisoner has waited centuries for visitors powerful enough to battle their way through the traps and guardians and finally set him free. Only by destroying the prisoner, whose will and power controls and maintains the demiplane, can the party finally escape back to their own world.

The adventure includes:

A new monk archetype – the tortured spirit monk.
New monster templates, including the monastic lich – an undead monk with superlative martial arts skills and a slew of new ki powers.
Exciting new monsters to test your players.




Fight for Freedom is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for four 10th level characters using the Medium XP advancement track.

This adventure can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world.

Upon completing the adventure the characters should be half way to level 11.

149659.name: Frampton's Folly
149659.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mad archmage Lorcan Frampton was famous throughout the land for his strange behaviour and crazy schemes. Nobody was surprised when he spent all the money accumulated over a lifetime on one final work - a magnificent stone folly just outside town.

The day after the folly's completion Frampton vanished in the night, taking all his treasures with him. Despite their best efforts his family have been unable to ascertain what happened to him or why he left.

Now a clue has been discovered that might help solve the mystery. A recently unearthed manuscript describes a series of secret vaults beneath the folly protected by fiendish traps and guardians. A brave group of adventurers is required to find the vaults and search them for clues to the fate of the missing archmage.

Each of the four main vaults beneath the folly can be played as a separate adventure with a minimum of effort by the GM, or the whole folly can be played over several sessions.

Frampton's Folly is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for four 5th level characters using the Medium XP advancement track.

This adventure can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world.

Upon completing the adventure the characters should attain 6th level.

149660.name: Fury Awakened
149660.description:
From publisher blurb:

A call for aid from a remote village sees the party pitted against a ravening beast, a monster that visits in the night, slaughtering livestock and terrorising the locals. After fighting off a series of vicious assaults the party come to suspect that the problem is a lot more complicated than it first seemed. Tracking the creature back to its lair, the party find it has made its home deep within the lost outpost of a forgotten race, filled with strange magical machines and deadly guardians. Can the characters explore their way through the complex, overcoming its challenges and solving its mysteries, to confront the beast at the end.

The adventure includes:

The village of Chendal and its inhabitants described in detail.
A clutch of exciting new monsters to challenge your party.
A fully described dungeon complex with over 50 rooms.
Clear and concise maps.
A new template and magic item.




Fury Awakened is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for four 5th level characters using the medium XP advancement track. This adventure can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world. Upon completing this adventure the characters should attain 6th level.

149661.name: Ghostly Powers
149661.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every ghost is unique, created through a unique set of circumstances, developing powers suited to its character, background, and manner of death. The core abilities are simply a starting point, presenting a few examples of the type of powers that ghosts can develop.

This sourcebook expands the options for ghosts. Everything you need to make your ghosts unique and memorable is included within, including:

50 New ghost abilities, many of which scale in power for ghosts for different Challenge Ratings, making encounters with ghosts truly unpredictable and dangerous.
17 example backgrounds, detailing how the ghost was created and finally laid to rest.




Ghostly Powers is a Creature Powers Sourcebook for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, suitable for GMs and Players of any level.

This material can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world.

149662.name: Beginnings 1: Grotto of Snakes
149662.description:
From publisher blurb:

Freed from an eternity as statues by a mysterious stranger, the party must find a way to escape the lair of the foul medusa sorcerer that turned them to stone. Though she is long since dead, her home still contains numerous guardians and challenges for the party to overcome.

Beginnings One: Grotto of Snakes is the first in a new series of adventures that offer original ways to start a new campaign with 1st level characters, avoiding the clichéd “you all meet up in the tavern”.

The module includes:

An exciting adventure for newly created 1st level characters, set within the lair of a dead medusa.
Detailed and clear maps in an easily printed format.
A fully detailed NPC – Nysta the tiefling rogue.
An extensive random statue table, allowing the GM to quickly describe the appearance of any statue in the adventure.
Details on how to adapt the adventure for 2nd or 3rd level parties, including additional stat blocks for all the encounters, already advanced to suitable challenge ratings.




Grotto of Snakes is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for four 1st level characters using the Medium XP advancement track.

This adventure can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world.

Upon completing the adventure the characters should be well on their way to 2nd level.

149663.name: Ruster's Blood
149663.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Philamont Bickles staggered into town half dead from exposure, telling a mad tale of how his fellow miners had been attacked from below by an unknown enemy, the only people he could count on to help him find out what had really happened were the brave band of adventurers currently in town.

The party must brave the depths of the mine and beyond to rescue or avenge the missing miners, finally learning the terrible truth behind the disappearances and coming face to face with their worst nightmares.

The module includes:

New variants on an old favourite monster.
Rusted Blood - An exciting new sorcerer bloodline with a host of new spells and abilities.
A new template - the chimeric shifter.




Ruster's Blood is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for four 4th level characters using the medium XP advancement track. This adventure can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world. Upon completing this adventure the characters should attain 5th level.

149664.name: The Witch's Revenge
149664.description:
From publisher blurb:

The witch is dead. By a fluke of fate the party has managed to put an end to her and her evil, freeing the village of Welker from her sadistic rule. Unfortunately, in doing so they find themselves under the effects of a powerful curse.

Can the PCs gather the ingredients for a magical cure from the witch's lair before the curse becomes permanent or they fall foul of her brutal ogrekin son. The main difficulty comes not from the lethal traps and guardians that protect her cottage and garden, but from the effects of the curse itself, for they must overcome all these hazards while trapped in the bodies of tiny animals.

The module includes pregenerated characters and a new minor artifact.

The Witch's Revenge is compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and can be easily adaped to any campaign. It uses the Medium advancement track and is designed for four newly created characters of 1st level who should be half way to 2nd level at its completion.

149665.name: Whispers of the Forgotten
149665.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the deep woods, a noble builds a new hunting lodge, not knowing that he is being manipulated by a forgotten evil that craves freedom after a century of being trapped in the crypts of a temple destroyed and erased from history. Can the players discover the truth as events escalate, defend the camp from the murderous guardians that prowl the woods, and survive a descent into the crypts to combat the horrors that lie below.

The module includes a slew of new monsters, a couple of new templates, and additional magic items.

Whispers of the Forgotten is compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and can be easily adaped to any campaign. It is designed for four characters of 4th level who should attain 5th level at completion.

149666.name: Boons
149666.description:
From publisher blurb:

Has your adventuring party ever found itself in any of the following situations?

The party decide to press on despite being low on resources, straight into an especially dangerous encounter.
A run of failed saving throws or unlucky attack rolls leaves the party undermanned and fighting desperately against an encounter that has suddenly become much more challenging.
The party have expended their limited resources early in the adventure, leaving them too weak to face the challenges ahead. Maybe time constraints or an inability to return the way they came prevents them from retreating or resting up.
The GM underestimates the threat posed by an encounter, possibly because the creatures really are overpowered for their challenge rating or more likely because they play especially well to your party’s weaknesses, or the party have already used the resources needed to face that encounter.
The adventure was sprung on the party with no chance for them to optimise their spell selections to meet expected challenges. Maybe the characters find that many of their spells and abilities are useless due to wards (such as forbiddance or dimensional lock), planar traits, or creature immunities (such as a complex of devils when the party wizard is loaded up with fire spells).




All of the above situations can result in frustrated players, character deaths, and even a TPK. Boon items allow the GM to throw the adventurers an in-game lifeline. They are powerful, single use items that increase survivability, offer cool abilities, or allow them to change recent choices.

The ebook contains 26 new items, encompassing a wide range of power levels – ranging from an incense that allows a wizard to change his memorised spells, to scrolls that contain the exact spell you need, elixirs that make the drinker almost invulnerable or allow them to split into two identical characters for a short time, and a rod that allows you to replay an entire encounter.

Wondrous Creations 0: Boons is a volume of magic item sourcebooks compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149667.name: Evil
149667.description:
From publisher blurb:

A truly horrid bad guy deserves to be kitted out accordingly. Evil doers are not constrained by the same rules as many adventurers. To them, using vile spells and items is an everyday activity, so they would certainly have items to assist them in their foul endeavours. The items presented in this ebook are primarily for evil characters. While not all of them are actually evilly aligned, they all have effects that would make goodly characters hesitate before using them.

This ebook is crammed with cool toys to give extra clout to the evil guys in your campaign, or to offer them protection from the those pesky holy weapons that seem to be an essential part of every PC’s gear. And if your PCs are the ones dwelling in grey areas, they will find plenty to intrigue them in these pages.

Take a dip into the dark side bran tub and see what you pull out.

This ebook contains 45 items for those that do not let their conscience get the better of them.

Wondrous Creations 10: Evil is a magic item sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149668.name: Elixirs
149668.description:
From publisher blurb:

Elixirs bridge the gap between potions and wondrous items, offering a relatively cheap way of gaining a powerful one-shot magical effect that can be used by anyone. As they are not limited to spell effects like potions, the scope of what elixirs can do is limited only by the imagination.

Included in this book are 58 elixirs of all power levels that will add depth and new options to any game.

Wondrous Creations 1: Elixirs is the first in a series of magic item sourcebooks compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149669.name: Beads
149669.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beads are versatile one-shot items that have an effect when hurled at an enemy or location. Most are used offensively to damage or debuff a target, or to create a defensive aura. Everyone has heard of the bead of force and the necklace of fireballs, iconic items that suggest a whole world of other beads.

Included in this book are 58 new beads of all power levels that will add depth and new options to any game.

Wondrous Creations 2: Beads is the second volume in a series of magic item sourcebooks compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149670.name: Cursed
149670.description:
From publisher blurb:

Often underused and unappreciated, cursed items have been part of the game since the very beginning but have lost much of their threat and danger in recent editions. Many GMs no longer make use of them, but the cursed item is a mainstay of both fantasy literature and films and deserves a place in every game.

As well as fiendish new cursed items, this ebook also contains ideas and tips on how to make cursed items more effective in your game. It builds on the concept of sleeper curses; items whose curses can lay dormant indefinitely, until activated by a very specific event, action, or method of use. Imagine the look of horror on your player’s face when he finds out that the item his 10th level character found at 1st level actually turns out to be cursed!

The ebook includes:

58 new cursed items of all types
Guidelines for using sleeper curses in your adventures.
An example list of dozens of possible sleeper curse activation methods.




Wondrous Creations 3: Cursed is the third volume in a series of magic item sourcebooks compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149671.name: Lair
149671.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book presents a number of magic items suitable for use exclusively in structures. Unlike most magic items, these creations are generally not portable, being constructed into the fabric of the building itself. The items are divided into the following categories:

Archways
Doors
Floors
Locks
Statuary
Walls




The ebook contains 44 new magical creations that are suitable for lairs and buildings of all kinds. Though player characters can freely make use of these items, their primary purpose is to protect and make strongholds safer for their inhabitants.

Wondrous Creations 4: Lair is a volume of magic item sourcebooks compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149672.name: Furnishings
149672.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most magic items are portable and designed with Player Characters in mind. This means that the choice for rich NPCs with no adventuring background can be quite limited. Collected together in this ebook are magic items based around the concept of furniture, ranging from beds and chests, to tables and rugs. These items are suitable for fleshing out the insides of temples, the homes of nobles and royalty, and the residences of the well off, including PCs who have constructed (or claimed) their own base of operations. Covering a wide range of concepts, from time saving and defence, to scrying, interrogation, and business, these furnishings add realism and depth to any game.

The ebook contains 41 new items of magical furniture for all levels of power.

Wondrous Creations 5: Furnishings is a magic item sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149673.name: Religious
149673.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presented within the pages of this new ebook are a wide selection of new magic items aimed at the cleric in your party. Though some of these items are of benefit to characters of any class, they are geared primarily towards clerical characters. Included are items that give new and enhanced options for domain use and channelling energy, items that boost summoning and healing, as well as a range of protective items to better protect the party. There are even a few items more suited to followers of darker deities.

The ebook contains 46 new items with a religious flavour for all levels of power.

Wondrous Creations 6: Religious is a magic item sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149674.name: Monstrous
149674.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most of the core magic items are designed for use by humanoids, the PC races in particular. While this is great for the players, it leaves monstrous creatures with the capacity for taking levels in spell casting classes, and therefore Item Creation feats, with much less choice. Sure, the old favourites are still available, and a ring of protection or amulet of natural armour is useful whatever race the wearer is, assuming they have fingers or a neck of course. But spellcasters tend to create items of power that enhance their own capabilities or cover their inherent weaknesses, and this opens up a whole new range of potential abilities and effects not usually available to humanoid crafters.

This ebook explores some of those options by describing the items a medusa wizard, a harpy bard, or any number of other monstrous creators might envision.

The ebook contains 46 new items with a monstrous flavour for all levels of power.

Wondrous Creations 7: Monstrous is a magic item sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149675.name: Trinkets
149675.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all magic items should have earthshaking abilities. Such items are common in most campaigns despite the fact that 99.99% or more of all its inhabitants could never afford to purchase them. In a world where magic is as common as it is in most games, everyone from the lowliest peasant to the richest noble would desire access to it, in the same way that people in our world want the latest devices and accessories. That is where trinkets come in. These are defined as magic items with very low powered effects that are affordable to aristocrats and better-off experts. Even the occasional high level commoner may have a trinket or two. Trinkets usually offer little in the way of power, but can make the life of their possessor easier in many ways, boost their earnings, or just improve their standing with the neighbours.

This ebook contains 59 trinkets to add realism to the equipment of non-adventuring NPCs as well as a number of ways of introducing them to a campaign.

Wondrous Creations 8: Trinkets is a magic item sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149676.name: Underworld
149676.description:
From publisher blurb:

The criminal underworld is a vast network that covers a multitude of vices and professions, from beggars, poachers, street thugs, pimps and alley bashers at the low end to high class madams, confidence tricksters and cat burglars at the other. Talented or ruthless criminals live well on their ill-gotten gains, and where there is so much power and wealth there is also a market for magic items, particularly those that enable the owner to gain more wealth and power, or at least to keep what they already have.

This ebook contains 50 items for those that live their lives in the shadows. Though primarily for rogues, there is much here to interest characters of all classes.

Wondrous Creations 9: Underworld is a magic item sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

149677.name: Sorderon's Shadow
149677.description:
From the back of the packaging:

Sorderon the wizard is evil. He's immortal too.
You must survive through nine heroic tasks before you find the means to slay him. Will you accept the challenge.

Sorderon's Shadow is a new kind of adventure game. It combines landscaping techniques (first seen in Mike Singleton's Lords of Midnight) with a sophisticated text editor. So now you can see every step of your quest and talk with characters too.

149678.name: DeZpair: 24 horas de deZespero
149678.description:
In DeZpair: 24 horas de deZespero, a band of mercenaries tries to rescue the survivors of a zombie-infested city before the military "cleans up" the place with a nuclear bomb. You have 24 hours to swipe the city clean of people before the bomb explodes!

The game uses a modular board made of tiles to model the city search and zombie attacks, with custom dice used for character skills. Players use the dice to fight the zombies, search for survivors, and loot anything that the previous citizens left behind before joining the undead horde. The tiles show how many zombies are in a location, and the game unfolds through the exploration of these tiles.

149680.name: Flight of the Nova-1 Revised
149680.description:
Newly revised and expanded to be compatible with Great Power.

From publisher blurb:

The world waits with baited breath as Apex Innovations, one of the largest manufacturers of advanced technology in Victor City is about to launch the Nova-1, an experimental space plane with a revolutionary new engine called the Fusion Inductor designed by Doctor Brom Solomon. The engine is powered by a theoretical fuel source called the Potentiality Sling, a process that converts irradiated material’s potential energy into thrust.

The Nova-1 Experimental Space Plane and its six brave astronauts fall victim to an attack by a team of supervillains determined to steal the Fusion Inductor!

The heroes must rescue the crew and stop the assault on THE FLIGHT OF THE NOVA-1!

149681.description:
This awesome set contains everything you need to recreate the daring raid that paved the way for the Allied D-Day invasion.

The Mission

The mission, in the opening minutes of the Normandy landings, was to capture the Bénouville Bridge and the nearby Ranville Bridge in order to prevent German reinforcements from reaching the beaches, where Allied forces were pouring ashore. 180 men, led by Major John Howard, landed close to their targets in gliders. Using the element of surprise, they were tasked with seizing the bridges, and more importantly, hold them against the inevitable German counter attack. Bénouville Bridge was later renamed Pegasus Bridge, in reference to the shoulder emblem worn by the British Airborne forces.

The Battlefield

Using the contents of the battle set, you can really set the scene for this pivotal battle. The centrepiece is a laser-cut model of the bridge itself, accompanied by models of the Cafe Gondre, as well as a pill box, a gun pit and even two telegraph poles!

Next come the forces themselves - for the defenders, 20 German infantry, backed up with a 5cm KwK 39 anti-tank gun and MG42 machine gun team. The attackers are a 10-man British Airborne squad plus a 2-man PIAT team, and an exclusive model of Major John Howard, which is only available in this set. You'll also get decal sheets for both the sides to help you prepare your forces for battle.

Last but not least the box includes a scenario booklet that describes how to set up and fight the battle for Pegasus Bridge. (Remember, this is a supplement for the Bolt Action game, so you'll need a copy of the core rules too!)

Box Contents:

Laser-cut Bridge
Laser-cut Cafe Gondres
Resin Gun Pit
Metal 5cm KwK 39 anti-tank gun and 3 crew
Laser-cut Pillbox
Metal German MG42 MMG team
2 laser-cut telegraph poles (on the Cafe sheets)
20 plastic German Infantry and plastic bases
Major John Howard and plastic base (exclusive new model)
10 man British Airborne squad and plastic bases
2-man PIAT team and plastic bases
Scenario booklet
Decal sheets for the Paras and Heer
149681.name: Bolt Action: Pegasus Bridge

149682.name: SteamBirds: Survival
149682.description:
User Summary

Become a celebrated fighter pilot by controlling one of sixteen different planes each with unique advantages and disadvantages. Steambirds: Survival features endless dogfights against an ever-growing number of enemies until you finally bite the dust.

149683.name: The Field Guide to Superheroes Vol. 4
149683.description:
Publisher's Description:

The Field Guide Vol. 4 completes the definitive encyclopedia of superhero archetypes in modern comics.

Written by Jason "Dr. Comics" Tondro, who studied comics for his PhD in Literature, the Field Guide is a gold mine of ideas and inspiration for your next hero. After a discussion of each archetype generally, the Field Guide then gives a fully fleshed out hero, suitable for immediate use as a PC or important NPC in your ICONS campaign.

Rather than break archetypes down by power set, the Field Guide looks at the character's origin and role in the story. This makes the archetypes much more versatile and puts the emphasis on character, rather than power.

149684.name: ICONS Team-UP
149684.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

The long-awaited sourcebook for ICONS is finally here! ICONS TEAM-UP, written by Steve Kenson, Gareth-Michael Skarka and Morgan Davie, is a Game Master's toolkit for the critically-acclaimed superpowered role-playing game, and includes:

Clarifications, answered questions and extensive examples for the original ICONS rules.
Add-ons and Variant rules, giving Game Masters a wealth of options for customizing their own ICONS experience.
Rules for Battlesuits and Military Vehicles.
Environmental rules for adventures in outer space, the astral plane, underwater or underground.
A complete system for designing and adding Sidekicks to your ICONS heroes, as well as special rules governing sidekicks in play.
A system for creating Super-Vehicles and Headquarters.
Universe-Style Play: a system for running extended campaigns in ICONS, where your group collaborates on creating an entire comic-book universe, with its own titles, heroes, villains and events, and
The Complete Icons Index: A full index for all four books -- the ICONS core rulebook, The Villainomicon, Great Power, and ICONS TEAM-UP.




So come on, chum! It's the CrisisAlert! Doctor Zodiac and his minions are causing trouble downtown, and it's up to us to team up and stop him!

149685.name: Pirates! A Dungeon World Sourcebook
149685.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Dungeon World sourcebook for your pirate campaign.

Contains rules for naval combat, black powder weapons and giant sea monsters. It also contains the Sea Dog class playbook.

"So ye want t’ be a jack tar, Laddie? Let me tell ye about life aboard a sailin’ ship. It be hell. Ships may be out t’ sea for months. The food be bad - dry bread full o’ weevils and rancid salted pork better fit for makin’ soap. Sanitation be worse. And disease! Yer teeth fall out and yer ears rot off. Do somethin’ wrong? It’s the cat o’nine tails for ye or even the keelhaul! And don’t even think about piracy or ye’ll swingin’ from the yardarm!"

149686.name: The One Page Dungeon Contest 2013
149686.description:
From the back cover:

The Task: design a complete dungeon in one page. The Complete 2013 Collection. Includes all 72 submissions, plus the 32 winning entries from 2010 and 2011 as a bonus. Check out the official 2013 One Page Dungeon Contest page for free downloads of the submissions.

149687.name: Shore Siege!
149687.description:
User Summary

You are shipwrecked on a far away, hostile island! Monsters are approaching! Protect your ship from the onslaught of enemies until you can get it repaired. Monsters cause damage to your ship if you allow them to reach it. Use the weapons you find lying around and stop them before they can cause damage. You can buy various nifty upgrades in between levels. Can you make it off the island without being overwhelmed?

149688.name: Dominions 4: Thrones of Ascension
149688.description:
You are a God! You are master and ruler of a loyal nation. You have unimaginable powers at your disposal. You have claimed this world as yours. But there are others who stand in your way. You must defeat and destroy these pretenders. Only then can you ascend to godhood and become the new Pantokrator.

In Dominions you take control of a powerful being that rules a nation and aspires to godhood. The type of Pretender Gods can vary from magically powerful arch mages to huge titans or large monuments. The pretender gods have different strengths dependent on what kind of god you choose and what nation you play.

When you start the game you decide what kind of god you are and how your Dominion affects your lands and followers. It is an expression of your divine might and the faith of your followers. If your dominion dies, so do you. Your dominion also inspires your sacred warriors and gives them powers derived from your dominion.

In order to win and become the one true god you have to defeat your enemies one of three different ways: conquer their lands, extinguish their dominion or claim the Thrones of Ascension.

In Dominions 4 you can also play team games where one of the players take the role of supreme god, and the other members of the team are his servants and loyal subjects. The lesser gods rule their nations, but you all share the dominion of the supreme god.

Dominions is set in a fantasy world that draws inspiration from historical nations, cultures and myths. You will not encounter the elves of conventional fantasy in this game. Instead you might lead a nation of vanir from old norse myth. Aztecs, romans, israelites, greeks, shona and kievian rus are just a few of the inspirational sources of the game.

The first Dominions game was released in 2002 and was well received by strategy gamers. Since then Dominions has been much refined and Dominions series is still actively played making it one of the longest running 4x turn based strategy games.

Dominions 4 is also a highly moddable game. You can create your own monsters, spells and entire nations. Since Dominions 3 there has been a vivid modding community and Dominions 4 will enhance this capability even further.

Source: The Developer Website.

149689.description:
High Frontier Interstellar is a solitaire expansion to High Frontier Colonization that allows players to travel out of our solar system to the stars beyond. It can be played independently or as an extension of a standard (Colonization) game.

To play you need all of the following:

High Frontier
High Frontier Colonization
The free Interstellar rules available from Sierra Madre Games
The Interstellar Map available on Zazzle.
149689.name: High Frontier Interstellar

149690.name: Testament
149690.description:
from the introduction:
Testament is a description of the last days of Earth. The game begins with the world ending. It doesn’t end in a day but rather over a period of time. Devils and angels walk the Earth picking out the last of the virtuous and the damned and helping or hindering where they can. People will not see winged beings plucking people from the street but they will notice people going missing and the world being seemingly populated by strangers.

The Players commonly take the roles of normal people who are still on Earth during this tumultuous period. The actions of the player characters will decide whether or not they are to be saved or damned and they may also perform a role in the judgement of those they meet. Common themes within the game are isolation, alienation, self-gratification, exploitation, retribution, redemption and damnation. These can be explored within the confines of the game using fictional characters.

from "Signs & Portents":
The world of Testament is different to our own. It is darker. The shadows seem deeper and the stars only dully gleam in the firmament. The sun still hangs high in the sky but even at noon it glares like a great yellow eye and few could ever say that it has been “too bright”. Pollution has taken a great toll on the environment. The air has a coppery taste and a biting chill accompanies the wind. Clouds roll overhead and often bring a dirt-laden acrid rain.

149691.name: Creed
149691.description:
from the introduction:
The rules you now hold form the basis for Creed, the second part of the Testament, a game from the Late Gaming Company. You can take yourself and a group of friends into the world of Creed and there bear witness to the last days. You will be able to tell stories of triumph and defeat, retribution and redemption. If you have not played Testament then your GM must believe you are ready for further revelations.

from the Narrator's section:
Creed is an addition to the Testament game. Testament did not have rules for Credo or for demons and angels but the groundwork was laid in that game to support Creed.

from the "Credo" section:
Credo is the “magic system” for Creed. Testament didn’t have any magic - but Creed characters can. Magic is the system of creating change according to your will. Technically lifting up a cup with your hand is a magical operation - but the real talent is doing the lifting without using your hand. Credo allows that to happen.

149692.name: Sever
149692.description: Sever is a role-playing game about the spirits of the dead who become Reapers, sprits who forge their will into weapons that sever the earthly ties of the dead who trouble the living.

149694.name: Checkorete
149694.description:
A Checkers variant for 2, 3, or 4 players. The game is played on a 14 x 14 grid of red and black squares, but with four squares in each corner taken out. The central 10 x 10 grid is the field of play and is marked by a thin white "Haven line." Player pieces are in four colors and begin in the four sections outside of the Haven line, called "King's Havens," on the black squares printed with checkers pieces. (Each player has 10 pieces.)

Rules are essentially the same as English draughts, but for the complication of having four players. Once players move their pieces into the field of play, they may not move back over the Haven line at any point on the board. Promotion is achieved at the furthest row in the field of play from each player. Rules are also provided for partnership play.

The central 8 x 8 square section of the board is highlighted so that it may be used for a standard game of Checkers.

149695.name: ΔV: The Game of Spatial Combat
149695.description:
Based on the elegance of chess, checkers, and go, and inspired by the beauty of deep space, DeltaV is the game of spatial combat.

Someday, humanity will harness enough energy to become a starfaring species. But what then? Will we explore the stars, united? Or will humanity fragment into the bubble of space around the Solar System? We're apparently alone in the galaxy, and if we turn inward, against each other, the war will be more frightening than any fought so far.

In the game of DeltaV, you can find out if you have what it takes to survive spatial combat. Fight against one to five other fleet commanders over a region of space. Deceivingly simple, the DeltaV board contains only as many positions as a standard checkerboard. But in three dimensions, those positions can have much greater significance.

One board supports up to six players, and multiple boards may be combined for even larger battles.

149696.description:
Rioting Gangs is a Booster-Pack expansion for the game Police Precinct.

It includes an assortment of new Event Cards in new locations:
3 Emergencies (3 different colors, all "Rioting Gangs")
1 Street Collapse
1 Caught In The Act
1 Budget Cuts
1 Homicidal Maniac
1 fixed Stolen Car

and

1 Compass fix (sticker)

Features:
Accommodations made to help the colorblind.
Block Numbers (to help find locations)
149696.name: Police Precinct: Rioting Gangs

149697.name: Fourplay Checkers
149697.description:
An adaptation of Checkers for 3 or 4 players, Fourplay uses a 10 x 10 grid of squares for its board, with four corners of four squares each left off. A border surrounds the central 6 x 6 "Field." The outer portions of the board are called "Bases." There are four colors of pieces; each player begins with 6 each and places them on the dark squares of their base.

The game plays essentially the same as English Draughts, but with a few differences. Once players move into the Field, they may not move back into their own or any other player's Base, unless it is as part of a multiple jump that ends back in the Field. Once a piece is in the Field, it moves as a promoted piece, in any direction. Captures are compulsory, and a player's own pieces may be captured.

Variations are provided, either for last-man-standing victory conditions, or for scoring points. Also a more challenging variation called "DUBL-CHEKRS" is described.

The board itself is reversible, with a standard 8 x 8 checkerboard on the reverse.

The board and instructions feature small diagrams of variations of the Fourplay board, with larger Base areas; it is unknown if the game was ever published with these alternate boards.

149698.name: Flip Flops
149698.description: Flip over the cards to collect sets of non-matching gear to win. Sets of cards are created or added to by all players. To start a set, put down two cards from your hand or to add to a set, you may play one card. Cards played must be different in all of the three elements on the card, gear, number and color. You keep the set if you are the one to complete it. The player with the most sets wins.

149699.name: Flashpoint Campaigns: Red Storm
149699.description:
You are the commander of either NATO or Soviet forces locked in battle on the ground in 1980’s Central Europe. As commander, it is your task to provide the battle plan orders to your units. You need to know your mission objectives, strength and weakness of both your forces and you enemy, lay of the land, weather, and time of day in order to come out on the winning end. Your crews will do their best to follow your orders and execute the plan, but in war, no plan survives first contact. You will need to think on the fly and adjust to the ever changing flow of battle.

Flashpoint Campaigns: Red Storm features an innovative asynchronous turn structure that models the OODA loop, huge maps, hundreds of meticulously researched platforms and weapons, detailed orders of battle, realistic modeling of modern combat including armor, infantry, helicopters, airpower and chemical and nuclear weapons, 3 campaigns and over 20 single scenarios, realistic weather conditions, modding options and much more!

After the end of World War II, Europe spent years recovering from the losses and the terrible consequences of the conflict. A whole continent found itself divided into two blocs: one lead by the United States with NATO among its allies in the Western bloc, and in the Eastern bloc lead by the Soviet Union along with the Warsaw Pact. Separating the two, an “Iron Curtain” formed of high walls and minefields as well as hundreds of thousands of well armed troops. This was the Cold War, a forty year state of political and military tension between two superpowers that several times came close to starting World War III. While the world survived the Cold War, the effects of the “long twilight struggle” still echo in the geopolitics and military technology and tactics of the present day.

In Flashpoint Campaigns: Red Storm, World War Three has started, the Cold War has turned hot. Do you have what it takes to achieve victory on the battlefield or will the world end with all out nuclear war?

Source: The Publisher Website.

149700.name: North South Battle
149700.description:
On July 16, 1861, the federal Army of the Republic was ordered to Richmond to capture the Confederate capitol. The two armies met at a railroad junction town called Manassas near a stream called Bull Run.

Now the commanders of the opposing forces can re-live and re-fight that famous battle. The board is stylized representation based on actual maps. The map is printed on vinyl coated paper with one inch hexes. There are 54 card stock printed pieces enclosed in clear hard plastic cases that stand upright. This is in essence plastic-cased minatures. The game has a hidden strength factor the effectively simulates the raw, unseasoned troops in the actual battle. There are also provisions for artillery fire, and terrain modifiers. Victory is obtained by eliminating the opposing player's 6 strength General, two 3 strength generals or all the enemy troops. Victory can also be obtained if the opposing player or team surrenders.

149701.name: Maelstrom Domesday
149701.description:
Publisher Info:

In 1984, a cult classic RPG was released: Maelstrom by Alexander Scott.

Featuring a historical setting, ordinary people as characters, the original freeform magic system and an extensive herbal section, this game sold huge numbers of copies around the world. Long out of print until Arion Games revived it a few years ago, Maelstrom nevertheless held a special place in the hearts of many gamers.

And now, Maelstrom returns in a brand new edition. The game is set in England in the year 1086, still suffering the aftermath of the Norman conquest twenty years earlier. The characters are “special agents” for a powerful Norman Baron, investigating the strange and unusual for a handful of coin, their only qualification being that they have themselves experienced a strange event!

This new version of the Rulebook features:

+ All new lifepath character creation system - a great mini-game in its own right!

+ Revised and updated living abilities and game rules still based on D100 and D6

+ Fast and deadly combat system with lots of tactical options

+ Revised freeform Magick system

+ Rules for the Maelstrom and Breaches

+ Referee advice

+ A guide to life in 1086

+ A complete setting guide to the area around York

+ 100 new herbs

149702.name: The Door
149702.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color floorplan of a Strange door.

The Product comes with the Hex, Square and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“Puny humans have come to our den to be second meal of night! We eat well now!”

The door is a single terrain map of a hilly, swamp terrain with a mysterious wooden door built into the largest hill.

The door is intended for use in fantasy settings. As a terrain map, it can also be used in wargaming fantasy scenarios.

The door can be used as the entrance to a burrow or den. Or it could lead to another world or dimension.

For a wargaming scenario, one idea is to use the door as a place for reinforcements to appear for the defending side. The attacking side needs to get to the door and close it to stop their reinforcements from coming in from another world, plane, or dimension. Each turn the door remains open, the defender gets a low cost unit for free that suffers no terrain difficulty with cliffs or swampland.

An adventure hook for use with this product.

Troll’s Den: A rash of night kidnappings has plagued a town close to a marsh. The group is hired to investigate these abductions. They may find some tracks leading to the marsh during the day. Alternatively while on watch at night, they spot tall, shadowy figures that abduct some villagers and follow them to the swamp. The bog is filled with the bones and skeletal remains of the previous victims. Its up to the group to quickly stop the trolls in the bog from getting to the door that leads to their den. If they are too slow, they’ll need to break down the door to the troll’s den and fight them in their home to save the villagers.

149703.name: Hellfire
149703.description:
From publisher blurb:

HELLFIRE!!

Half-demon and totally evil, Hellfire reigns over her own dimension and has her sights on Earth! With the power of her namesake at the tip of her fingers, she's raising an army to conquer the world and take down any heroes in her way!

149704.name: These Mean Streets
149704.description:
from the Introduction:
Jakálla Foreign Quarter is tough place, not quite lawless anarchy, but the authorities care little what happens to na- komé scum, foreigners and aliens and only shift themselves to intervene in crime when riots are threatened and inducements offered.

This leaves the field free for ‘freelance’ law enforcement by the inhabitants themselves and opportunities for those down on their luck to haul themselves out of poverty by preying on those even less lucky. Tsolyánu may be a paradise to its citi- zens, who hymn the Emperor every day for his divinely man- dated rule, but is a cruel place to the non-citizen, foreigner and outcast. The resultant gangsterism is tolerated as long as it stays within the walls of the Foreign Quarter and does not affect any citizens of any standing.

from The Plan:
Having been rescued from a days highly demeaning and unpaid labour in the sewers, the PCs will no doubt be curious as to what Jüggash has in mind. He ushers his men into the front room of a run down wine shop and explains the deal; evict the Ügremish, a bunch of no good Nakomé scum and he is willing to pay 40 hlásh, 10 up front, 30 on completion of job and bonuses for captives, 5 hlásh for a child under 14, 10 hlásh for a woman, and 12 hlásh for a man. There are 10 men, 12 women and 18 children as far Jüggash can tell.

149705.description:
With a beer in one hand and a mallet in the other, the knights of the back garden clash in a dirty duel in which cheap tricks, low blows and bad excuses are the order of the day. Who’s getting the beer?

Gameplay in Croquet: A Cardboard Game takes place in turns, with you playing your ball via cards such as "It's Crooked", "Smack in the Arse" and "Almost Straight". Outside your turn, play as many countermoves you can, whether to annoy the enemy or to optimize your game, countermoves such as "Didn't You Skip Me?", "Ouch! My Foot" and "You Shoot Like a Little Girl".

Description from the first introduction to the game at Fastaval convention:

Croquet is an ancient, noble game where there is only room for the most filthy, sneaky, bullying and vile jerk on top of the podium. The game requires a delicate balancing act between ingenious shots of your own ball in near-impossible zigzag course towards the end pin, and absurd croqueting of your opponents' balls far of the grid. Anything goes. With victory follows the crucial bragging rights - so don't leave your balls at home!

If you like games like RoboRally, Golfmania and Family Business, then croquet - a card board game is just for you.
149705.name: Croquet: A Cardboard Game

149706.name: The Original Flatland Role Playing Game (The Flattened Remix)

rpg.3064: The Original Flatland Role Playing Game

149706.description:
Publisher's description:

Imagine a world of two dimensions and plane geometry, in which the very idea of height is considered insanity and the darkest heresy. Where the only thing that matters is the straightness of your sides and the regularity of your angles. Where the slightest deviation from the norm can lead to arrest, imprisonment, execution (and consumption by your peers) or a lingering death by starvation.

Welcome to Flatland. Enjoy your stay . . .

This is a free "light" version of The Original Flatland Role Playing Game; it contains the full rules and two adventures, but omits another adventure and adventure outlines, a wargame by Matthew Hartley, cutout characters, scientific discussion of the two-dimensional world, and the novel on which the game is based.

149707.description:
This exclusive expansion to Coal Baron adds 5 "phasecards" to the game during setup.

The cards change the shift phase of the game. Every turn begins with choosing one of the cards (this allows the player to choose in which part of the game the players can use their workers).

The cards give a special bonus to the player who uses them.

--

The expansion was available at Essen 2013 with the limited wooden box version.
149707.name: Glück Auf: Phasenkarten

149708.name: Fallen of Obsidian Twilight: Asi Magnor
149708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sheathed in fragrant wrappings and armored by magic and sheer age, the undead emperor Asi Magnor conquered the world before, and after, his death. He radiates power and malevolence, the desire to rule and the power to clutch the world in his claw-like hands or crush it beneath his sandaled feet. Asi Magnor was born into a long and unbroken line of kings in the desert Kingdom of Shaan. The Shaan were known, before the cataclysm, as a peaceful and cosmopolitan people with ornate and elaborate death rituals, but in the time of Asi Magnor, some three thousand years before the cataclysm, they were a war-like people with advanced cities, agriculture and great command of magic.

149709.name: Fallen of Obsidian Twilight: Calix Sabinus
149709.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wings spread, maw agape, sheathed in leather and gold and spun from the blood of thousands stands Calix Sabinus, god-emperor of the undead lords, bringer of death, destroyer of angels, a power before the cataclysm, a tyrant after. There is nothing more dangerous on all of Abaddon than Calix Sabinus. Calix has killed thousands, enslaved millions and crushed the wills of all that live on the lands of terror called Abaddon. To see Calix Sabinus can easily mean death. To actually meet Calix Sabinus face to face means worst that that. Tempt fate if you dare.

149710.name: Fallen of Obsidian Twilight: Zebadiah
149710.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Angel Zebadiah. Half beautiful, half monstrous, the angel Zebadiah bears the scars of his losses and defeats down one side of his body, stripped back to burnt and blackened musculature, like a diagram in some wizard’s book about the anatomy of the dead. Zebadiah’s eyes gleam madly with the feral anger of a caged animal, as though he is pacing back and forth in his mind, confined to a single, hellish reality when he is used to soaring between the planes. This is hero, the closest many will ever get to the gods again, but he scares you…

149711.name: Watch the Skies
149711.description:
From the Introduction:

It’s 1957, and you are in Palomar Gardens, the slightly seedy California home base of “Professor” George Adamski’s flying saucer cult. Tonight the extraterrestrials that have been visiting Adamski for years are returning. He’s announced that they are arriving to meet his followers and welcome them to the cosmic colloquy of enlightened beings. A flying saucer will fly overhead, and later the extraterrestrials will arrive in Palomar Gardens. It’s the night everybody has been waiting for - the desert sky is clear and bright, the air is charged with anticipation, and the cocktail bar is fully stocked.

149712.description:
Content: 15 Orange God tiles (expansion can only be played with original Bora Bora game from Ravensburger)

Place the Orange God tiles in the general supply next to the game board.

At the beginning of phase A, if a player rolls two of the same number he receives one Orange God tile from the general supply. If he rolls three of the same number (i.e. the same number on all three dice), he receives two Orange God tiles. If a player rolls two or more of the same number but there are no Orange God tiles left in the general supply, he doesn't receive anything.

Whenever a player places a die on an action card, he can use the Orange God tiles to turn his die 1 number up or down. The tiles then go back into the general supply. Note: the die number must be changed before the die is placed onto an action card. One die number can be changed per Orange God tile used. Also note, a die showing the number 1 cannot be turned down to a 6, and a die showing the number 6 cannot be turned up to a 1.
149712.name: Bora Bora: Orange God Tiles

149713.name: World of Obsidian Twilight
149713.description:
From Introduction:

From out of the dark and forbidding heavens a great meteor, black as night itself, carved through Abaddon’s atmosphere, calved into massive sections and rained down upon the world in great shards. It obliterated cities, shattered the living rock, sent tidal waves swamping over islands and drowning the coasts, ignited volcanoes and set the ground quaking for more than a year.

Over 85% of the sentient population of Abaddon was killed in moments and no sorcery, no prayer, no force of arms nor cunning with the builder’s craft could stand against the destruction. Those who survived found themselves in the ruins of civilization, surrounded by the corpses of their nations, overwhelmed by death and living beneath a soot-black sky.

Their suffering did not end there. The meteor was a black, hellish thing, infused with vast amounts of necrotic energy. The survivors watched in horror as the power of the meteors fragments and its dust began to raise the dead and few of the remaining cities survived the onslaught of their own deceased.

The deaths, the trauma, the spiritual and necromantic energy, all released together, changed something fundamental on Abaddon. A rarity and a curiosity before the cataclysm psionic abilities began to manifest amongst the survivors and those few children born of these years, a reaction to the failings of magic and prayer and a sea-change of the mind, one that allowed some to survive this apocalypse.

149714.name: Bionic Dues
149714.description:
Robot rebellions should be quelled by the best of the best. When the best of the best are killed... it's up to you. Subdue the uprising in time, or your corporate overlords nuke the city.

Bionic Dues is a tactical, turn-based roguelite with mech customization. Guide multiple classes of Exos through a variety of missions filled with enemy robots that are as buggy as they are angry. This is at least as bad as it sounds. Explore for loot, destroy key robotic facilities, and brace yourself for the final attack by your enemies... just as soon as they can pull it together

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Summary

The Robots are uprising they are building an army to attack your HQ in 50 days. You have that much time to accomplish various missions (23 different types) to improve your Exos(or Mechs)squad and face their final onslaught.

Build your squad of 4 Exos from 6 different classes, Assault, Siege, Science, Sniper, Ninja and Brawler. Then select 1 pilot from 6 possible choices each having a poweful special power.
Exos have various rating including, Power (Weight), Shield, Computer, Stealth, Sensor, Propulsion. Plus various weapons and improvement slots.

Then, the game is all about fulfilling missions to get loots to improve and customize your squad. Basically each mission take one day and bring you closer to the final battle. At the end of each day the robot factories produce some more bots However a very few missions count for 5 days and allows you to trigger the final battle sooner. Some others missions target robots factories which slow down a little their productions.

During each mission you control only one of your 4 Exos at a time, you can change which one you control depending on the tactical situation. The game is played in turn on a square tiles. Each turn you can do one action, Move, Attack, Change Exos, Hacking,Special...then all activated robots take one action each.

The gameplay is very tactical and sometimes almost puzzle like, as there is no luck in combat. There are a number of hazards on the ground, both helpful and harmful. And you can identify enemy robots from a distance depending on your sensors. Then it is a matter of finding the best course of actions to avoid attacks and possible chain reactions and to hack the locked door to find loots.

149715.name: Haymaker! (Issue 63 - 2013)
149715.description:
User Summary

Foreign Legion Theme Issue

In this issue: An Extra Segment; A Closer Look; Ad Nauseum; Around the World in 6,912,000 Segments; Leah’s Notebook; Power Point; Surbrook’s Stuff!; Tiger’s Tale; TribMuse; and Soliloquies.

149716.description:
North of BORISOV, RUSSIA, 4 April 1943: Operation Lenz Sud had commenced in hopes of finally reducing or eliminating the growing Partisan force near Borisov. As the German forces began the push the partisans were ready and awaiting for an ambush. The Partisans were not trained soldiers and the tactics of the partisans were simple and the challenges put on them by their leaders were less than would be expected from a military unit. Surprise and ambush were their best tactic. Their spot chosen lay on both sides of the Narotch stream. Having capturing a German field gun earlier and using their long hidden anti tank gun—a leftover from the retreating Russians in 1941—the ambush was prepared. Mines were placed, demolition charges were planted by explosive teams smuggled behind German lines and now the wait began. One Partisan survivor remembered: “We would ambush the Germans on the Narotch stream bank. We knew the Germans planned to come to the aid of the guard from the other side of the stream. Our commander, Sagalchik, was also a guide, as he had lived in Miadel for many years and was familiar with the area. When we arrived everything was quiet. Suddenly shots were heard. We lay down and awaited the Germans. When we received the sign to attack we ran to the houses where the Germans and Lithuanian sharpshooters were. The battle lasted a few hours and the Germans dispersed.” Within an hour the fight was over leaving the battlefield in partisans hands. The Germans suffered 40 dead and over 50 wounded. “Lenz-Sud’ was off to a bloody start.

Bandenkrieg: Hell Behind the Eastern Front is a historical module depicting combat that occurred during an anti-partisan operation, Operation Lenz Nord, near Borisov in Byelorussia in April 1943.
149716.name: ASL Comp Bandenkrieg: Hell Behind the Eastern Front

boardgamecompilation.29690: Finland at War, v. I: Jatkosota

149717.description:
(from the introduction and user's description:)

The three majors wars of Finland are represented by scenarios in this product: Winter war, Continuation war and Lapland war. There is also a bonus scenario that depicts action from "Vapaussota" (Finland's war of independence in 1918).

Fire & Ice is essentially a combined and revised reprint of two previous scenario packs: 1996's Jatkosota and 2004's Finland at War.

Components:

special rules (8 pages)
