The game is over when all cards have been played. The winner is the one with the most answer cards. In case of equality the digits on the answering cards are counted, higher number wins (i.e. "2" is one digit and "1.25" is three digits).

To sum up the idea of the game:
Finding the answer was easy - but where is it?

149828.name: Ski The Mountain
149828.description:
Ski the Mountain is a competitive skiing game for up to six players in which the board is the piste map. The game recreates a real day on the piste with challenges, restaurant stops, and unexpected events.

Players begin at the bottom of the mountain with targets to achieve during the day. Each player plans his route, then sets off to ski as many runs as he can before the sun sets at the day's end.

Each turn players can collect piste cards to add to their hand, travel up ski lifts, or play piste cards to ski runs. Event cards can be played throughout the game to hinder your opponent or give you an advantage. Remember not to get stuck on the mountain when the sun sets!

Players score points for each run completed with additional points for some named runs. Each completed target scores additional points. Whoever has the highest point tally at the end of the day wins.

149829.name: Arkeos #03, Les Cendres du Dragon
149829.description:
Arkeos was published in the guise of small magazines with the first one being the core rule book.

This third issue covered the following topics :


Les lois de la magie (page 3 to 34)

All the needed rules to let magic enter the world of the 1930s, including:

rituals, alchemy, relics and artifacts of power, monstrous powers and weaknesses, creatures of the night
focus on some mystic traditions: Bönpo, tibetan monastery, voodoo, christendom and the Inquisition
two new archetypes: magician and mystical warrior





L'Asie (page 35 to 76)

Setting section presenting Asia with a large focus on China and colonial presence of occidental nations.


campagne Arkeos (page 77 to 98)

Three new stories that take place right after the ones from [item=149813] to continue the campaign.


Other

The interior page of the back cover features an magic sheet that can be used by players to record the spells they know.

149831.description:
The 21 Mutinies: Treasures of the Empire mini-expansion consists of five treasure counters that are shuffled with those from the base game to offer more variety during play. These counters give you:


Gold, either 1 or 3 coins depending on which you draw
One victory point
A jewel accompanied by two bottles of rum
A wooden leg, which is worth nothing but a fun prop at parties
149831.name: 21 Mutinies: Treasures of the Empire

149833.description:
This 2013 promo card for the Rivals for Catan was given out by Klaus Teuber at SPIEL 2013 in Essen (and can also be bought in the Catan Shop). A limited English-language version was released during a Cyber Monday promotional at the Catan Shop on Dec. 2, 2013. Only 50 copies were listed as available to the public and a $50+ online purchase was required.

It is a unit/hero.
It costs 1 lumber and has 1 skill point.
It has a red "Base Game" back.

German text of the card:
"1 x in Ihrem Zug: Sie dürfen 1 Rohstoff einer Landschaft, in der Sie 3 Rohstoffe besitzen, gegen 1 beliebigen anderen Rohstoff tauschen."

English text of the card:
"1x during your turn: You may exchange 1 resource from a region where you have 3 resources for any 1 different resource of your choice."
149833.name: The Rivals for Catan: Gavin the Polyglot

149835.name: Ulvesagaer
149835.description:
From the front of the book:
Ti eventyr til Ulvevinter
En udvidelse til rollespillet
Ulvevinter
Af Bjarne Sinkjær

From the rear of the book:
Ulve-Sagaer er en udvidelse til bordrollespillet Ulvevinter.

I Ulve-sagaer finder du:

Ti eventyr til Ulvevinter. Ni af eventyrene har tidligere været udgivet på Ulvevinters hjemmeside, men bringes her i bogform, i nyredigerede udgaver.
Det tiende eventyr, Knive i mørket, er et helt nyt eventyr, der handler om mord, mørk magi og forræderi i byens skjulte kloakker.
Helt nyt er også en længere beskrivelse af Højby, hovedstaden i kongeriget Frit Anirr.
Der er også fire små artikler, der fortæller om begravelser, tyvenes lav, byen Hvideborg og om selterne - det gamle folk på Tharos.




Ulvevinter er et rollespil der foregår i en fantasiverden, der er beboet af tapre vikinger, vise troldmænd og farlige uhyrer.
Læs mere om Ulvevinter, og hent masser af gratis materiale, på:
www.rollespilsforlaget.dk

Translates to:

From the front of the book:
The adventures for Ulvevinter
An expansion for the tabletoproleplayinggame
Ulvevinter
By Bjarne Sinkjær

From the rear of the book:
Ulve-Sagaer is an expansion for the tabletoproleplayinggame Ulvevinter.

In Ulve-sagaer you will find:

Ten adventures for Ulvevinter. Nine of these adventures have previously bee published on Ulvevinters homepage, but are now available in print, in a new edited version.
The tenth adventure, Knives in teh darkness, is a brand new adventure, about murder, dark magic, and betrayal, in the dark sewers of the town.
All new is also an longer description of Højby, the Capital of the kingdom Frit Anirr.
There are also four smaller articles, about burials, thieves guild, the city Hvideborg and about the selters - the old people of Tharos.




Ulvevinter is a roleplayinggame, taking place in a fantasyworld, full of brave vikings, wise wizards and dangreous monsters. Read more about Ulvevinter, and get lost of free material on:
www.rollespilsforlaget.dk

149837.name: Arkeos #04, Les Reflets de l'Histoire
149837.description:
Arkeos was published in the guise of small magazines with the first one being the core rule book.

This fourth issue covered the following topics :


Un monde de science (page 3 to 38)

Presentation of the scientific knowledge in the 1930s with:

details about ancient almost forgotten science and space conquest
large focus on (mystical) science of the third Reich including secret projects and researches
new rules regarding mad scientists and the creation and use of infernal devices with the mad scientist being a new playable archetype.





De l'Orient à l'occident (page 39 to 71)

At first, this part of the book follows the Orient Express, starting with a description of the city of Istanbul.
Following up is an in depth view of the third Reich.
The train reaches its final destination: Paris.
The travel goes a bit more to the west until it reaches the city of New York where a new archetype is met: the Butler.


campagne Arkeos (page 72 to 99)

The last four stories of the campaign.

149838.name: The Channel Islands Game
149838.description:
The Channel Islands Game is based on the real routes and itineries in the Channel Isles. In playing the game hazards and dangers are encountered similar to those experienced in real life. It is only by chance and skill that a player can win.

Object of the Game:

To complete a tour of all five islands marked on the board, using the travel tickets to St Peter Port having successfully visited and placed a counter on a cross on each of the five islands.

149839.name: Befuddled
149839.description:
Each round in Befuddled, you roll 14 word dice and try to find words before a timer runs out. A special die rolled at the same time determines the minimum word length for that round; at the same time, special "shake-it-up" cards add restrictions, e.g., forbidding the use of an "s" to make words plural, removing two letter cubes from the current roll, or playing a round with your opposite hand. Each word that you alone create out of the rolled letters is worth one point if it's exactly as long as the minimum word length; longer words are worth more points.

The player who first passes a point threshold — or alternatively, the player with the highest score after a predetermined number of rounds — wins.

149843.name: Χρηματιστήριο
149843.description:
In this game the players are stock market share holders, trying to put their opponents out of the game by bankrupting them. The game is based on the Greek Stock market of the 90s and the press of the era.

It has many similarities to Monopoly, but in place of real estate now there are company shares. Houses and hotels are replaced by percentage of the company in stocks, owned by the player. Paying money based on stocks they own to other players as well as various taxes and public service bills may cost money to the players similar to monopoly.

An interesting change is the fact that two players can merge their shares in order to get a bigger percentage payment from other players.

The goal of course is to take out of business your opponents by causing them to go bankrupt.

149845.name: Royal Assassin
149845.description:
Your father, the king, united four small fiefdoms into a mighty kingdom. Now that he is dead, the former royal families of those fiefdoms are plotting to take over the throne that is rightfully yours. You are outnumbered, but in your struggle to defeat them you have a powerful ally: your court jester, the Joker, who as your father's friend and advisor was always much more than he appeared to be. He is highly skilled at court intrigue, and can help set them all against one another so that you can retain your throne. He is your secret weapon - your Royal Assassin!

This solitaire card game is played with a standard 52 card deck with 1 (or optionally 2) Joker cards. The goal is to eliminate all royalty cards before the stockpile runs out.

149846.name: Les Carnets de Voyage Arkeos, Les Cités d'Or
149846.description:
This booklet was intended to be the first in a new line of supplements for Arkeos, each one introducing new settings for the gamemaster to create his own adventures.

This first "Carnet de Voyage" contains a few rules about archaeological researches and excavation during the 1930s and four of the most mythical and mysterious cities of the ancient times :

Babylon
Carthage
El-Dorado
Angkor




Each city description contains the following elements :

History and mystery of the city
Description of the site with (partial) map
Important people the players could meet
Some important scenes the players should live or plot twist they could face if adventuring in the search for the city treasures and mysteries.

149847.name: Chronos Veritas
149847.description:
from the introduction:
This is a very short (about two hours) adventure for RealTime designed as an appetizer and warm-up, a way to get players used to how RealTime works and to work out kinks in the process. It's intended as either the first or, even better, second exposure to RealTime for both player and GM. In essence, it's one extended encounter, but it still offers a taste of almost everything RealTime has to offer, a chance to use just about every rule in the game, and a good exposure to the excitement and time-focused action of RealTime.

from the Starting situation:
The game will begin with the PCs' team being on duty in response-ready condition at the DARRT office in Dennison, MA...

At 14:00 exactly, a call comes in over the intercom from Judy Terrence, their dispatcher. “Okay, attention, DARRT team Romeo Tango Fiver, hostage situation in progress at Chronos Veritas corporate headquarters, New Dimensions Industrial Park, route 182 exit 88 south. Attempted burglary went sour; suspects appear to be armed. Little information available at this time. Ship out in ten minutes, more information will be provided en route.

149848.name: An Excursion Into Old Ch’óchi
149848.description:
from the webpage:
This adventure was written for the Tirikélu rules system, but can be easily adapted to others.

While at leisure in Ch'óchi, in Mu'ugalavyá, the protagonists see a number of interesting statuettes and pots for sale in the bazaar. The people selling these are obviously from remote rural areas. It is possible to get guides to take one to where these artifacts are found - a journey of some days, and not an excursion for the faint of heart!

149849.name: Divine
149849.description:
from the introduction:
Divine is a scenario designed for veteran Delta Green, but it can easily be adapted for any use. Investigators are assuming the roles of FBI consultants, but official federal authorities are not aware of this fact. The players must use cunning and force of character to perform necessary inquiries rather than rely on federal support on the ground, all the while avoiding suspicion. Cell A will attempt to choose agents and friendlies who have no ties to the FBI, hoping to keep the incident out of the FBI’s grasp until it can be thoroughly resolved.

It is recommended to run this scenario with 4-6 players.

149850.name: Deep Water
149850.description:
from the introduction:
Deep Water is intended as a beginning scenario with which to kick off a large-scale Cult of Transcendence campaign. Although it is designed for a group of investigators who are already a part of Delta Green, it should not be difficult to adapt it to a group of law enforcement officials with no prior supernatural experience (considering the large amount of “vanilla” investigation present).

It is recommended to run this scenario with at least four, but no more than six players.

149851.name: The Unmasking
149851.description:
designer's comment:
This adventure is an attempt at a sequel to my favorite scenario “The Evil Stars” by Keith Herber from Cthulhu Now. I’ve also Delta Green’d it and reconciled the old Hastur references to the John Tynes version of the Hastur Mythos from Countdown.

user summary:
Agents are brought in to investigate a mysterious new hallucinogen being distributed by a biker gang in southern California.

149852.name: Special Operations Manual
149852.description:
DGList comment:
A permanently shelved monograph for BRP

subtitle:
Role Playing U.S. Special Operations Military Soldiers in the modern era

from the Introduction:
The purpose of the Special Operations Manual for Chaosium’s Basic Role Playing system is to provide keepers and players the opportunity to utilize these extreme soldiers in any situation they can imagine. This manual will provide all of the details and information needed to include Operators in the most realistic way possible within the confines of the BRP system.

This supplement is intended for an action oriented campaign where the extra weapons and combat skills will be not only desirable but essential. The characters outlined here should be far above normal human characters in almost every aspect, combining the physical prowess of Olympic level athletes and the problem solving and critical thinking skills of a private investigator or a competitive chess player.

Specifically, this manual is set in the modern era, real world setting. However, it is perfectly suitable to apply these characters to a horror, sci-fi, or super hero or any other campaign from the Viet Nam war to a near future or alternate reality setting.

149853.description:
“Just as water retains no constant shape, in warfare there are no constant conditions.” –Sun Tzu

Weapons clash, water splashes and the booming battle cries of armored bullfrogs ring out across the moonlit swamp. Amphibian armies leap from lily pad to lily pad in their desperate struggle to win control of the pond.

Suddenly, a shout of triumph rises up. Enough warriors have finally entered battle on a lily pad to dominate the fight and assure victory for their side. Overloaded, the lily pad sinks into the swamp.

Frogs scatter from the sinking lily pad to the surrounding ones, coming to aid their allies or sabotage their foes, their weight causing the lily pads to drift away across the cold, glittering water. The winning commander must understand the ripple effects of every move, and avoid acting to win a single battle at the cost of losing the war.

•••

In Bullfrogs, 2-4 players ages 8+ take control of warring factions of frogs and fight over lily pads in a pond over the course of 20-40 minutes.
149853.name: Bullfrogs

149854.name: Floor It!
149854.description:
From the back of the box:

Floor It! is very easy to play. Players choose the number of laps to race and then move around the track by choosing one of three card types - Floor It!, Cruise, or Take It Easy.

The game is a trade-off between speed and safety. Each player must decide how they will drive in order to safely navigate the course. It is safest when driving in a straight section of the course. The greatest danger is when driving in a corner. A driver who decides to go fast or "floor it" is more likely to crash than a driver who chooses to "take it easy".

149855.name: Tumblin' Tree
149855.description:
From the publisher:
Take turns growing a tree by adding leaves and branches onto a wobbly, not always cooperative trunk. Whoever causes any part of the tree to tumble must pick up the pieces. Trunk can be adjusted to increase difficulty, making this fun for the whole family. It is made up of natural wood. An outrageously fun eco-balancing game with lead free paint.

User note:
This might be an uncredited and/or unauthorized version of the SdJ Kinderspiel winner, Arbos.

149856.name: Jolly Roger
149856.description:
Jolly Roger is a simple dice game containing six dice, each of them has the "1" replaced with the image of a Jolly Roger.

The goal is to capture the most cargo and score the most points. On his turn, a player rolls all dice and for each Jolly Roger rolled, he can "capture" one other die and score its points. The player may re-roll any dice two times. Should he come up with 5 Jolly Roger symbols, he scores no points this round.

After a given number of turns, points are tallied and the player with the highest score is the winner.

149857.description:
A special map for playing Catan on the island of Corsica.

The game follows the usual Settlers of Catan rules with two major differences:

- Settlements and roads may only be built on marked spaces
- Victory point chits are put on some crossing points marked on the map; they are claimed by the first player who builds a road there
149857.name: Catan Geographies: Corsica

149858.name: Odyssee (Issue 3 - Oct 1998)
149858.description: The third (and last?) issue contains a scenario for ERPS, a generic/ universal SciFi scenario, a special weapon for Midgard, ERPS herbs, and assorted articles, cartoons and reviews.

149859.name: The Assassin’s Primer
149859.description:
From the puiblishers website:

The Job of Death

Some people call it wetwork. Others call it murder. A small group calls it justice. It’s assassination and it’s one of the jobs shadowrunners might be hired to do. And given that people are, you know, pretty protective about their lives, anyone who takes such a job is going to have to be at the top of their game to pull the job off and collect a payday. Especially if they plan to make it a regular activity.

The Assassin’s Primer is a vital guide for assassins in the Sixth World. With tips on tools to use, techniques to employ, and the different kinds of killers you may meet in the field, this is a critical reference for anyone looking to bring an assassination flavor into their Shadowrun games. And it has a new sniper rifle and a handful of new Qualities for Shadowrun characters to boot!

The Assassin’s Primer is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

149860.description:
Arena Gladiators is an expandable card game where players pit their gladiators against each other in the arena. The first player to gain 5 victory points (from winning arena matches) wins the game.

Gladiator cards come in two varieties: standard and named. The standard gladiators represent authentic gladiator types: hoplomachus, murmillo, retiarius, secutor and thraex. There is a named gladiator (including Spartacus) for each type, which have additional traits to give them an edge in the arena.

The fast and easy to learn combat system uses a ‘rock-paper-scissors’ style approach where ability cards determine the attack type (defence, might, speed, and accuracy). They also provide powerful combo effects which can be used by a gladiator with the corresponding speciality (each gladiator type has a unique combination of two specialities).

Event cards provide arena variations as well as ways to gain or lose cards, hinder your opponents, influence votes and much more. Players can also negotiate and trade with each other, adding an element of politics when it comes to deciding the fate of defeated gladiators with a ‘thumbs up’ or ‘thumbs down’ vote.
149860.name: Arena Gladiators

149861.description:
The booklet Quest: Zeit der Helden - Abenteuerband 6 contains two solitaire adventures for Quest, both of which won an adventure design contest held by publisher Pegasus Spiele:


"Der Sammler der Lieder", a solo-scenario for the hero Talorien.
"Karomins Berufung", a solo-scenario for the hero Karomin.


Both adventures feature the start of the adventuring career of the hero mentioned and should be played with one player and one Questmaster only.
149861.name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Abenteuerband 6

149862.name: Ringbote (Issue 8 - Oct/Nov 1995)
149862.description: Besides a huge chunk of reviews and news around trading card games, board games and RPGs, this issue offers a fantasy adventure (for Midgard, but easily adaptable to other games and settings), an interview with artist Paolo Parente, and an article on video game development. Con reports round it off.

149863.description:
Castro, first released as Cuatro, mixes two games: Yahtzee and four-in-a-row.

On a turn, a player rolls five dice to make a set from one of six categories: pair of a kind, three of a kind, four of a kind, full house, straight and poker. They may reroll any or all of the dice up to five times. There is also a board with spaces marked with aforementioned six categories and four sets of pagoda roofs, with 15 pieces per player. The result of dice roll specifies where a player's roof can be placed. As soon as the player puts four pagodas in a row (either horizontally, vertically or diagonally), they win the game.

The trick is that the player can place their pagodas on already occupied spaces on the top of other players' pieces if they achieved necessary result in a number of rolls less or equal to five minus the number of pagodas. (For example, if two pagodas are on a space designated to three of a kind, the player must achieve this result in no more than three dice throws.)
149863.name: Castro

149864.description:
Genius Loci is a two-player combinatorial game played on a hexagonal board. According to the Romans, a genius loci is the spirit of a place; in this game, the spirits allow movement between places.

Playing pieces consist of men, in two colours, belonging to the players; and gods - neutral pieces which can neither capture nor be captured, but enable the movement of the other pieces.

Each turn consists of the following steps:
(a) optional - move a god
(b) required - make a sacrifice; move a man of your colour according to the rules of a god, so as to capture another piece (a sacrifice)

The game ends when a player may not make a sacrifice on their turn. They lose.

This game is inspired by the "Activator Piece" discussions in the BGG abstract games forums.
149864.name: Genius Loci

149865.name: Vino Tinto
149865.description:
In this tactical game, each player takes on the role of a Spanish wine merchant and try to achieve the highest income with excellent wine.

But the competition and many a storm complicate the business. Since it is important to see how the market develops and when the growing areas receive the "mark of the season." In addition, any player can get through clever recommendations to the commission of wine tourists.

The player can trade with 3 different varieties: Tempranillo (purple), Garnacha (blue) and Mencia (light blue). The player who has achieved the highest earnings after 4 votes, winning this card game.

rpgitemversion.327194: In Strani Eoni: Numenera in chiave Lovecraftiana

149866.name: In Strange Aeons: Lovecraftian Numenera
149866.description:
Publisher Blurb

"Lovecraftian horror is cosmic horror. It is the terror that comes from the realization that the universe is vast, inhospitable, and uncaring. That humanity’s desire to find our place in it is fruitless—that we have no place. We are insignificant and meaningless specks in the unfathomable reaches of both space and time, and there are entities in those reaches so monstrous and vast that should we come to comprehend them—even a little—that comprehension would surely devour our sanity.

It should be no surprise that this fits Numenera particularly well. Humans of the Ninth World are steeped in aeons, living in the shadows and remnants of civilzations whose accomplishments defy their comprehension daily. Surely this greatness of past carries to them a taste of this cosmic horror—as, perhaps, do the worlds, dimensions, and entities touched by those ancients."

149867.name: Activation Petteia
149867.description:
This game was created for a design contest as documented here:

http://boardgamegeek.com/article/13809424#13809424

The game is played on an uncheckered board of 8 rows and 12 files; the game does scale though to boards of smaller size. Each player starts the game (sitting across the board from one another facing a long side of the board) with 12 stones placed in the nearest row, 10 identical pieces starting one each on all spaces except the two corners each of which is occupied by an activator. A supply of neutral colored stones and of additional pieces in the player's own color (designated white and black) are also needed.

All stones move like rooks in chess, i.e., vertically or horizontally in an unobstructed line.

The object is to create a situation where one has at least twice as many pieces on the board as one's opponent or where the opponent has no legal move. Draws are not possible.

What's notable here is the use of two activator pieces based on an a notion created by designer Joe Joyce, as per the contest mentioned above. This allows captured pieces to be removed from play, converted to immobile neutral pieces or replaced by a piece of one's own color, depending on how they are captured.

149868.name: Destiny Beginner (Prometheus Edition)
149868.description:
This is a new, enlarged version of Destiny Beginner. It contains more scenarios and ilustrations.

From publisher blurb:

Hast du jemals eine Geschichte gelesen und dich gefragt, wie sie ausgegangen wäre, wenn du an Stelle der Hauptperson gestanden hättest? Im Pen&Paper-Rollenspiel kannst du das, und Destiny Beginner zeigt dir den Weg!


Erschaffe deine ganz persönliche Hauptfigur in weniger als 5 Minuten!
Bestehe Abenteuer mit Schwert, Grips und Magie in einer Stadt voller Intrigen, Konflikte und Geheimnisse!
Statte deinen Charakter mit fantastischen Fähigkeiten aus, die allein deiner Vorstellungskraft entspringen!
Das vielseitige Würfelsystem und die intuitiven Regeln passen sich mühelos deinen Abenteuern an!


Dieses Buch richtet sich an alle, die sich ins Reich der Fantasie führen lassen oder selbst Spielleiter sein wollen. Es enthält alles, was man dazu braucht: Spielregeln und Tipps, die abenteuerliche Stadt Lys Marrah, Szenarien und Charaktere zum Ausprobieren und ein Spielleiter-Solo.

Tauche jetzt ein - in eine Welt voller Abenteuer!

Google/ user translation

Have you ever read a story and wondered how it would have ended if you had been there in place of the main character? In pen & paper role-playing game you can do just that, and Destiny Beginner shows you the way!


Create your own individual main character in less than 5 minutes!
Experience adventures with sword, brains and magic in a city full of intrigue, conflict and secrets!
Outfit your character with fantastic abilities that arise solely from your imagination!
The versatile dice system and the intuitive rules go seamlessly with to your adventures!


This book is aimed at all who would like to be shown the realms of fantasy or who want to be game master themselves. It contains everything you need: Rules and advice, the exciting city Lys Marrah, scenarios and premade characters to try out, and a solo adventure.

Dive right in - into a world full of adventure!

162568.name: Holmes 13: Hope S. Hwang Promo Card

149869.description:
In Sherlock 13, first published as Holmes 13, the players take the role of a detective, trying to unmask the famous thief Arsene Lupin, who is among them in disguise.

The game consists of 13 character cards, with 2 to 3 characteristics each. Each characteristic is shared by 3 to 5 characters. The cards are shuffled and one is drawn and put aside. This card represents the disguise chosen by Arsene Lupin. The other cards are distributed evenly among the players. The players now tally the total of characteristics they have on their cards (e.g. 2 detectives, 1 female, 0 genius etc) and note them for later use.

Players now take turns, asking a question to gather new evidence:

a.) To all players: "Who has (at least one) of (this characteristic)?

OR

b.) To one player: "How many of (this characteristic) do you have?

Using these clues the players try to figure out which disguise Arsene has chosen (i.e. which card is missing). Instead of a question, a player may announce which character he suspects to be Arsene in disguise. That player then secretly checks the hidden card. If the suspicion was correct, this player wins the game, otherwise the player is eliminated and the other players continue.
149869.name: Sherlock 13

149870.name: Tome of Twisted Things
149870.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are proud to present our third product in our Little Red Presents line (first two were Medjay & Fencer)- Tome of Twisted Things!

We try to showcase up and coming designers, giving them a chance to cut their teeth on a book. This time we've got wonderfully twisted classes that blur the lines between good and evil!

Included:

Darkborn




Prestige Class
By welcoming demonic energies into their soul, darkborn are a weapon good uses to combat evil in its own home. Using a unique bargaining/betting mechanic darkborn fight back against the darkness at the cost of their own immortal soul. But beware, this path of power is seductive and more than one darkborn has fallen to the power they wield...

Avenger




Paladin Alternate
You are not good nor evil, all you care about is revenge. By making a deal with a god of vengeance, avengers are given the power they need to seek the revenge they so desire but must help others!

Ruiner




Antipaladin Archetype
Charged with bringing about the destruction of the world, ruiners are not interested in petty things like demons or selfishness. They seek to destroy- plain and simple. They revel in the pain they inflict and serve no lord...

Tyrant




Prestige Class
It is fair to say that all men desire power. Often the world descends into chaos as men squabble and bicker over who deserves power, as each tries to gain more power than the rest. Few are the men who seeks to wield this power with a sense of purpose. The tyrant stands among these privileged few, assured on his right to rule over lesser beings. Whether a despot or duke, benign or barbaric, all tyrants seek to rule over the land and impose their will to end chaos they see around them by whatever means necessary.

Warped




New Race
Born from an unnatural union of humanoid and eidolon, the warped are forever marked by their planar heritage. While it is not as uncommon as some wish for a summoner to be intimate with their eidolon, any children resulting from the union are usually put down if found out. Nearly universally feared or despised by most cultures, the warped tend to see life as a struggle.
Also Included: Bloodborn Warped Summoner, and Monk of the Flowing Form
archetypes.

Over 20 New Feats




Including story feats for evil outsiders seeking redemption, warped racial feats, and metamagic feats!

This book is great for evil campaigns (like Way of the Wicked, something set in the Underdark, or a game in/from Cheliax if you are doing Golarion ) or even in campaign settings where things are a little darker (Ravenloft and Eberron come to mind).

149871.name: Monster Templates: Headless Horseman (Pathfinder)
149871.description:
From publisher blurb:

With a hip-hip and a clippity-clop
He's out looking for a head to swap
So don't try to figure out a plan
You can't reason with a headless man!

Turn your NPC or favorite humanoid monstrosity into a decapitated rider who haunts the trails, paths, and roads that pass through the wilderness. Turn the quest for its lost head into your next adventure or make him the servant of your true villain though the possession of the horseman’s head. Give him unique mounts or leave him with the traditional horse. Let him be the iconic mercenary or perhaps a female dragon rider. Enjoy the classical terrors or throw something truly new at your players while still taking advantage of the emotional response players have to the headless horseman.

Brought to you by the same author who has brought you Book of Monster Templates, 101 Not So Simple Monster Templates (Pathfinder), 101 Monster Feats, 101 Variant Monsters and a new free monster template in the Pathways e-zine each and every month for over 30 issues. Bring dread and terror back into your game with the Headless Horseman!

149872.name: Prince Charming, Reanimator

rpghonor.25528: 2014 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

149872.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 0th-level funnel for DCC by Daniel J. Bishop

Prince Hubert Charming, son of the Baron of Westlake, and heir to Westlake Manor, is well known as a cold man, whose watery blue eyes seem to betray no emotion at all. Yet he is a great lover of beauty, as all his wives have proven. The first he found working in the cinders of a woodsman’s cottage. Some say that the girl’s jealous stepsisters threw her down a well to prevent her from becoming the young prince’s bride, but even death did not bar Prince Charming, and she enchanted everyone at the wedding. Her stepsisters were placed in spiked barrels filled with hot coals and dragged through the town until they themselves died.

Whatever process Prince Charming used to revive his bride, it did not last forever. All too soon, the Princess Ella took ill and died.

Charming then found another bride, and there was no doubt in this case that she was dead. She was entombed in a glass coffin guarded by half a dozen or so dwarves. Yet,
when Prince Charming injected his magic elixir and kissed her upon the lips, her eyelids fluttered open and she breathed again! The story was told that the new Princess had been in but a deep coma, a sham of death, until a poisoned apple was dislodged by the Prince’s kiss. But folk began to whisper in dread, and none were surprised when it was announced that Princess Snow, like Princess Ella, succumbed to a fatal illness after only a few years of marital bliss.

In all kingdoms there are tales, and in the Barony of Westlake, it is said that the Grimmswood hides the ruins of a long-lost realm. The daughter of its final king, cursed by a malevolent faerie, pricked her finger on a spindle upon her sixteenth birthday, in the blossom of her youth, and died. With her death, the kingdom went to ruin. Few now dare to go far into the Grimmswood, although the riches of the lost kingdom are said to lie unclaimed within. Fear of dark fey magic and even greater evils keep men out.

Or they did so until now. For Prince Hubert Charming of Westlake has determined that the long-dead Princess Beauty is only cursed to sleep away the aeons, and he will have her for his bride. His men rounded up a stable of “volunteers” at the beginning of one early autumn morning, and here you are, with what makeshift arms and equipment you had upon you when you were “volunteered”.

Your mission, the Prince’s Bailiff explains, is to enter the ruined castle, find the place where the “Sleeping” Beauty lies, and bring her forth for Prince Charming to restore with a kiss. Those who choose not to go upon this quest must take their chances with the Prince’s Guard, twenty men strong, and be declared outlaw. Those who choose to hazard their lives within the ruined castle may keep what they find, apart from the sleeping princess, but dare not leave without her.


How Did We Get Here

This product comes about due to the confluence of several factors.

First, I had planned to do a series of fairy tale-based adventures for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG, titled Faerie Tales from Unlit Shores. The idea was to combine classic fairy tales with one or more strong Appendix N influences, to create something that accentuated the folkloric (and often dark) fey elements of the original tale and the adventurous energy of Appendix N fiction.

Second, my good friend Raechel Henderson, who was the first person to ever pay me for a piece of writing, had a Kickstarter project that was moving slowly. I asked my readers to help spread the word about Raechel’s project, in return for which I would write a free adventure. The adventure you are now reading is that free adventure. Her project, Spellbound and Spindles, is related to fairy tales too, making this a perfect tribute to those who contributed either with dollars or links.

Finally, Mark Gedak of Purple Duck Games not only agreed to publish the follow up series of fairy tale-based adventures, but also to publish the free adventure professionally. You will be seeing at least five more adventure in this series, creating a full arc from 0-level to level 5. If they are popular, I (or others working with Purple Duck Games) might do more.

I hope you like them.

149873.name: The Seven Deadly Skills of Sir Amoral the Misbegotten

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

149873.description:
From publisher blurb:

In years long past, Gryffon Keep was a border fortification guarding a somewhat well-used roadway. In that day, the keep was placed in the trust of Sir Harold Amoral, one of the greatest warriors available to the then Lord Duke. Time has changed the land, and brought the keep low, and Sir Amoral has become little more than a figure of fable and children’s story. That the ruins in the forest were those of fabled Gryffon Keep have been forgotten by most, and the area is now known to locals as the Forest Ruin.

Although history has faded to legend, the ghost of Sir Amoral still haunts the ruined keep. During his lifetime, he sought to hoard his martial knowledge so that it might never be used against him by a mortal foe. Now, after death, he regrets this parsimony, and seeks above all to pass on his skills to those who are worthy.

The catch, of course, is that the ghost believes that only he can determine who is (or is not) worthy – and, of course, his methods for doing this are deadly.

149874.name: The Folk of Osmon

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

149874.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mighty civilization once thrived where now only lonely Osmon Mire stretches across the land. The crumbled and vine-laden ruins of ages-old buildings arise here and there from the reedy mud and water. The remains of statues and derelict temples adorn low hills rising from the muck. Fell beasts roam the mire at night and man-like shapes haunt the swamp. After dark none willingly passes the low hill, with its blood-encrusted altar stone, where the Folk of Osmon are said to sacrifice their victims.

149875.name: The Falcate Idol

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

149875.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cult of the Harrower is ancient, and each of the eight eyes of its spider-idol is rumored to be a moonstone gem the size of a pigeon's egg. Moreover, somewhere within the cult's sanctuary, a pool flows from the Egg of Creation. Will your Thief seek to make a legendary score? Will your Wizard pursue the shards of the Egg? Will your Cleric join the cult? Or will your Warrior fight his way through the web-covered passages to rescue them if they fail? Any or all of these scenarios are possible!

149876.name: The Black Goat

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

149876.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all mountain passes are lonely.

Come meet the Mahmat Troth and the One they adore. Only in the high pass will you discover what the Black Goat truly is.

149877.name: Legendary Evil
149877.description:
From publisher blurb:

We have all heard tales of the diabolical young villain who finds a magical weapon from times long forgotten. That villain grows in power and infamy alongside the magical weapon until they both reach their true potential.

Within this product you will find 24 legendary weapons that will grow in power alongside your evil Pathfinder Roleplaying Game character.

The legendary weapon include the following weapon groups:

Axes (axe of minos)
Blades, Heavy (infinity's edge, linnorn blade)
Blades, Light (black spider, dogfryer, grim cutlass, infernal device, liar's tongue)
Bows (bow of swarms)
Close (saurian armor spikes)
Firearms (hell's eye)
Flails (adderwhip, cranial flail, ghost-fire, grasping electrum, manticora)
Hammers (brothar hammer, slime mace, stonefist)




Monk (quarterstaff)

Polearms (griffon claw)
Spears (heartseeker, leaden spear)
Thrown (black spider, fungal bola)




The time for disposable magic items is over. These items would be a great addition to an evil character-focused adventure path or in the hands of your player's BBEG.

The legendary treasures series does not use the legendary weapons rules from the Mythic Adventures book by Paizo Publishing, instead we continue to use our own legendary treasures rules introduced on the Grand OGL Wiki and supported through our releases and the releases of other publishers who have adopted it as their leveling up magic item system.

149878.name: More Legendary Items
149878.description:
From publisher blurb:

We have all heard tales of the heroic young adventurer who dons magical armor from times long forgotten. That adventurer grows in power and acclaim alongside the magical armor until both reach their true potential.

Within this product you will find 15 legendary items that will grow in power alongside your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game character. Traditionally legendary wondrous items have only have five levels of advancement but for the first time we have now included ten levels of advancement for six of the include 15 items.

The wondrous items that have become legendary with this release include:

Broom of Flying (Broom of the Trollmire Coven)
Knight's Pennon (Crusade's Banner)
Crystal Ball (Eye of Paletius)
Efficient Quiver (Favor of Kalashi)
Font of Blessing (Decanter of Endless Water)
Giald's Boots (Boots of the Winterlands)
Hat of Tricks (Bag of Tricks)
Iron Crochan (Cauldron of Resurrection)
Mechanism of Torl (Apparatus of the Crab)
Orphan's Rise (Boots of Striding and Springing)
Ranklekor Gloves (Gloves of Arrow Snaring)
Rod of Bound Chaos (Rod of Wonders)
Saevyne's Wings (Cloak of the Bat)
Saren's Horn (Horn of the Huntmaster)
Veliquari Relic (Hand of the Mage)




The time for disposable magic items is over.

149879.name: Covenant Magic
149879.description:
From publisher blurb:

A medium is willingly possessed by a raging ghost to lure it into a magical trap. An occultist bribes a satyr lord into granting him mastery over stormy skies and hardened hearts. A queen makes bloody sacrifices to fiendish masters for perpetual life. All use covenant magic.

Legendary Classes: Covenant Magic from David Nicholas Ross introduces covenants, secretive bargains allowing characters of any class to draw on the supernatural gifts of spirits such as fey, outsiders, and undead. This book also introduces mediums, true masters of covenant magic who can contact spirits, call on a spirit guide for supernatural attacks, empower allies and hinder foes with spell-like abilities, and enter a trance that unlocks covenants without a price and enhances their toughness and magical might.

This book contains the following:

The medium base class, specializing in one of 11 influences such as Angelic Choirs, Restless Souls, or the Unseelie Court.
Favored class options for mediums of nearly any race.
A new spell, expel spirits, for mediums and witches.
Covenant magic rules, including five new feats for characters of any class.
60 covenants.
Optional rules for alternative covenant offerings, such as years of life.

149880.name: Rune Magic
149880.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a place on the world of Porphyra called the Theater of Arrival, though no plays are found there. What is found there is a ring of twenty-seven stones, all an odd maroon color. The stones lie pm a field of glass, as if some great heat, light or pressure had been brought to bear on it. Though no play is performed here, there is art, of a sort. Each of the stones bears several images, three, in fact, two of which are the same on every stone, and one different. The similar images bookend the different on each stone, and appear as the engraving of a tall, thin humanoid with pointed ears, and a muscular humanoid with tusk-like fangs and fierce demeanor. It is said that if you look at the images long enough, in that wind-swept place, they start to look more and more like each other. The central image of each stone is unique. It is here that the elven runecasters and orcish runereapers triggered The Calling and irrevocably changed the face of Porphyra.

This third release in the Legendary Classes lines presents two alternate classes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game:

Runecaster (alternate alchemist)
Runereaper (alternate barbarian)




The runecaster is a voiceless spellcaster who is able to shape the fundamental aspects of magical power, leave behind invisible explosive runes, and unlock the powers of legendary treasures quicker than others.

The runereaper is an arcane-fuelled warrior that is first into battle. Using the runes carved into his flesh he is able to activate many additional combat powers multiple times per day. The more he defeats enemies in combat, the more he can access his runes.

Additionally, favored class bonuses are listed for all the Porphyran playable races just like we showcased in Legendary Classes:Covenant Magic.

Note: The runecaster class uses the Word of Power mechanic from Ultimate Magic by Paizo Publishing, you will need access to that book or one of the many Pathfinder SRD sites to access the additional material needed.

149881.description:
A promo package for all kickstarters consisting of 15 new tiles for the game as well as four cards with rules.

The new tiles are:
2x Chapel
2x Tavern
2x House of Trade
2x Weaponsmith
2x Craftsman
2x Inn
1x Library
1x Armory
1x Gallery
149881.name: Archon: Glory & Machination – Kickstarter Stretch Rewards

149882.name: Into the Wilderness: Map 5
149882.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Wilderness: Map 5 is a map-pack by Crooked Staff Publishing that depicts the layout of a single wilderness encounter area (in this instance an area of marshland).

What follows is a brief preview of what is contained in this product:

A pdf booklet containing three versions of the same map; one overlaid with a square grid, one overlaid with a hex grid, and one with no grid overlay at all.
Each map (i.e. the square grid, hex grid, and gridless version) is also provided as a jpg image optimised for use with virtual tabletops (note that these have been scaled at 50 pixels per grid square)
In addition, all three versions of the map have been supplied as multi-page, miniatures scale, pdfs - so that they can also be used as impromptu battle-mats




Please note that the battlemaps are not intended to be comparable to high-resolution dungeon tiles (as there are far better options for that kind of thing available from other sources), but are rather a simple and effective way of transforming this wilderness map into a quick battlemat (should the need arise).

149885.name: Te Kuiti
149885.description:
Te Kuiti (Teh-KOOO-ee-tee) is a simple game of memory and area control, with each player taking on one of two asymmetric roles. The "sheep" player tries to match two sheep (memory), while the "shepherd" player strategically builds fences to wrangle the stragglers (area control). A fortunate shepherd may find old posts that can be made into quick fences, but an unfortunate shepherd may find a fence ruined by a strong-willed ram. Players score points based on which sheep they find hiding and the number of stragglers they best corral.

After the first game, players swap roles and play a second game. The player who scores the most total points from both games wins!

149886.name: Noris Schach
149886.description:
A game of Chess for 3 players, Noris Schach (Noris Chess) is played on a hexagonal board divided into triangular cells, with a bight of 5 cells taken out of every other side, leaving a total of 106 triangles and three corner areas of the board where pieces will begin from. Each player has the normal complement of Chess pieces, but for an extra Pawn and another piece called the Cardinal, which moves like a Queen but cannot capture and can only be captured under narrowly defined circumstances involving both other players.

The game is then played according to the usual rules of Chess, but for the complications of an extra player and additional directions of movement resulting from the triangular cells.

149887.name: Bobo Grabbelboom
149887.description:
Learn to count in a fun way!

Choose a card with sums (for smaller children it is possible to choose a card with only numbers) and lay it in front of you.

Each player grabs a number-card from the Lucky Dip Tree on his turn. Is this number the result of one of your sums? Bingo! Be the first to complete your card and you'll win the game!

But be carefull for those tricky cards. When turning Bobo you'll be able to choose a number card of your opponents, but with some cards you have to give one of your cards to one of your opponents!

149888.name: Mountain Mayhem
149888.description:
Mountain Mayhem is the ski-based cross sport of racing and bludgeoning set in a fantasy universe.

Players choose skilled skiers to tackle the particular mountain course (and the competition), grab some equipment and muster their courage to face the obstacles laid before them...including the other skiers. Choose your skier and your equipment wisely, avoid the pit traps and skier attacks, deal some damage yourself, and plan the smartest course. Do this, and you may just win the game.

Players score points for speed and points for pain. Do one. Do the other. DO BOTH! Players score 1 point for each point of damage dealt and 1 point for each space they are ahead of the last place skier at the end of the game when a skier crosses the finish line.

149890.description:
A small free expansion, handed out to fans at Spiel 2013.

With this expansion you get four new town tiles.

Tile 1: When taking this Town tile, get 2 Victory points and move 2 spaces forward on each of the 4 Cult tracks. This tile provides 2 Town Keys.

Tiles 2 and 3 (double-sided): When taking this Town tile, get 4 Victory points. You may move the Marker on your Shipping track forward one space and get a number of Victory points as indicated on the Shipping space you move to.
As a Fakir, from now on, you may skip 1 additional space when doing a Carpet Flight.
Tile 4: When taking this Town tile, get 11 Victory points.
149890.name: Terra Mystica: 4 Town Tiles

149891.name: Bobo Rijmspel: Uitbreiding Grabbelboom
149891.description:
Bobo and his friends are fond of rhyme. Bobo says 'book' and Tjerk immediately replied 'cook'! So they can go on for hours!

This upgrade kit for the Bobo Lucky Dip Tree teaches young children about playful rhymes and reading. Choose a word map and bulletin words from the Bobo Lucky Dip Tree. Look for words that rhyme with the words in your word map. Be the first player to fill the whole map to win!

149893.name: Perspective of Mirrors
149893.description:
In Perspective of Mirrors, players take on the roles of intelligence directors utilizing various assets to complete espionage operations and score Information Points. Players use the Espionage cards to alter the landscape and achieve goals. Assets are utilized in the field to seek clues and information vital to success. Operations are the missions handed to you from above that need to be completed.

Being in the right place at the right time can make the difference between success and failure. When states spy on states, not only are the proper assets required to be in the right place at the right time, but also with the right support. It takes a skillful mastermind to direct your nation’s assets in a manner that is beneficial to your missions but also confounding to others.

149894.name: Friends in Foreign Parts
149894.description:
from the introduction:
The following is another scenario for the Tirikéku rules. Set during the reign of Dhich'uné the Usurper, the adventure involves Tsolyáni citizens in Mu'ugalavyá. Because it is an extremely role-playing heavy scenario, it can be easily adapted to any rules set.

from Setting the Scene:
The protagonists are staying at the Red Star clanhouse in Khéiris, a coastal city in southern Mu'ugalavyá. The Clan Patriarch is Hekkúnish Mátir, a quite capable Tsolyáni-speaker. Khéiris has two off-shore lighthouses. Most of the coast is dangerously rocky with high cliffs, but there is at least one good sheltered cove. At this time of year the weather is blustery, with high humidity and warm rains blown in off the sea. Occasionally hurricanes bring cooler rain, but this is naturally not very welcome since it puts a halt to all shipping and often costs lives due to flooding, storm damage, etc.

The adventure begins with Hekkúnish asking the protagonists to go up to a villa on the cliff-tops to look in on Ssiriei hiFushmangar, a clan-member of Tsolyáni extraction. He explains that she arrived home unexpectedly after a trip abroad and he just wants to see if there's anything she needs. Since the protagonists are Tsolyáni themselves (and presumably include at least one Red Star member), it seems appropriate that they go to drop in on her.

149895.name: Five Xing
149895.description:
From the Introduction:

This is narrative-focused RPG. This means instead of mechanical rules, the game world is defined by description and narration. The game mechanics only helps to interpret the events, but doesn’t provide answers to what actually happens.

This game is meant not to confine, but to inspire you.

There are no quantifiable stats for the character and no difficulty level for the challenges. The action are instead defined by the way the character does them, for example, forcefully, carefully or deviously.

The success of the action is determined by the metaphysical balance of five mystical elements, and each action in turn impacts this balance.

194391.name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Crusher Expansion

149896.description:
Description from the publisher:

Alien vs Predator: The Hunt Begins is a dynamic, tactical board game for one or more players that allows you to take control of one of three Forces: Alien Xenomorphs, Predator or Human Colonial Marines and face off against each other on a derelict spacecraft called the USCSS Theseus.

From Alien Xenomorphs skulking in the shadows, waiting for the moment of weakness to pounce on and capture new hosts for the brood, to the well-trained Colonial Marines who are geared up with state-of-the-art equipment and finally to a mysterious race of brutal extra-terrestrial Hunters that the humans call Predators, each Force offers a unique set of skills to provide their own diversity to the gameplay. There’s no shortage of terror and excitement in Alien vs Predator!

Alien vs Predator offers many challenging game types, which can be played by one or more players and a main campaign consisting of 10 Missions joined together into a narrative story depicting dramatic events taking place on board the USCSS Theseus, this game provides hours of suspense and action! Alien vs Predator can also offer two sets of rules (Basic and Advanced) which offer beginners a chance to jump into the action easily but allows for depth and growth for experienced gamers alike!
The game is a "sandbox" game so fully moddable.and with future addons will open the game world up even further !

Each 32mm miniature is masterfully crafted and is part of an expanding range of miniatures to collect for your games of Alien vs Predator! Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required.
149896.name: Alien vs Predator: The Hunt Begins

149897.name: PairPlay
149897.description:
PairPlay is "a memory game with an educational twist. How well do you know your European countries and their capitals?" (quoted from the publisher blurb)

It is a variant of Memory, containing 108 cards (54 pairs) of European flags. When a pair is found, the player has to name the country and its capital to claim the cards.

149898.name: Ringbote (Issue 14 - Oct/Nov 1997)
149898.description: The 14th issue contains the usual articles and reviews on a variety of games and gaming topics, plus two scenarios, one set in the world of Babylon 5 (GURPS stats are also given), another for Midgard.

149899.name: Präludium
149899.description:
from the back of the book:

1927. For the United States it is a time of growth and prosperity. The average American enjoys the amenities of speakeasies and jazz. All this will change, change very soon. As a medium of a mysterious pasts perceives impressions of the future and gets almost driven to madness, for the characters a series of adventures begins that they will drive them in the next two years across four continents and beyond. They'll need to turn against the machinations of a global conspiracy, that wants to changed the global power structure to be drastically.

Die Bestie (the beast) is a three-volume campaign, which leads the characters in a total of 18 chapters to the edge of the Great Depression in 1929. Can the characters thwart the plans of the Brotherhood of the Beast before it's too late?

The campaign is based on source material from the American Day of the Beast, which was heavily revised and expanded. Volume 1 also contains two completely new adventures of German offspring as well as a new Regionalia Cthuliana: India.

149900.name: Reisen: Passagen in den Tod
149900.description:
from the back of the book:

In the footsteps of the mythos, the characters often hunt around the globe, rushing from one city to another, from one continent to another.
Travel makes this an essential element in the lives of the characters: the constant back and forth to always be where the Cthulhu Mythos rears its ugly head. The book illuminates the 20es and is divided into a source part and six adventures. Here, the characters drive with an automobile through New England, use a hellish train, get caught in a storm on a luxuray liner amidst the Atlantic Ocean, nearly get driven mad on a rundown ship off Indonesia, must save a flying boat on a transatlantic flight from a crash, and free an airship from a ghastly evil.

149902.name: Mango Republic
149902.description:
Mango Republic is a tabletop game for two to four aspiring dictators. Players use their cards to expand their power and attempt to take complete control of the government of a nascent democracy.

There is a board to keep track of the activists, parliamentarians and generals in Mango Republic. Tokens placed by the player on the districts count as activists, tokens on parliament count as members of parliament, and tokens on Fort Peace count as generals.

The more activists in a district the player has, the more parliamentarians he gets. The more parliamentarians he has, the more cards he can hold. Cards give you options to gain activists, generals and hurt your opponents.

Whoever establishes complete control over the government, wins.

boardgamecompilation.153137: Among the Stars: Expanding the Alliance

If Section Seal separates your Station in more than 2 parts, it still applies. You only count the locations in the smallest part though.

149904.description:
Azarias - The Conspirator

149905.description:
Earl Von Venture’s Guide!

In Seekers: Treasure Hunt, you are an archeologist, and your goal is to find the buried treasure.

Objective:

There are 4 clues in every game. Land on all 4 eye stones to collect clues to find the exact location of the treasure and dig for the treasure.

Gameplay:

In order to play the game, each player starts by selecting two character cards and drawing 3 playing cards. Each character will be represented on the board game map by a colored gem, which will be used to search for the treasure. Each player's character starts at the designated start boxes. Now the game is ready to be played!

Choose a player to start the game.The game is played in turns, in a clockwise direction.The following are the actions each player takes during his/her turn:

1. Draw one card from the top of the playing cards pile.

2. Activate Character Abilities and Move each of your characters.

3. Use any number of cards (playing cards and treasure chest cards) in your hand.

4. Discard extra cards.

During the game, players can go to the various treasure chest tiles to collect treasure chest cards, each of which has a special ability.Some of these cards help you get to the eye stones faster and help you win faster.

The game ends when one player lands on the treasure location and digs for the treasure.
149905.name: Seekers: Treasure Hunt

149906.name: Capt'n Sharky: Abenteuer auf der kleinen Schatzinsel

boardgameimplementation.36727: Capt'n Sharky: Abenteuer auf der Schatzinsel

149906.description:
Capt'n Sharky and his mates are looking for the treasure of Pirate Bill. But not every hiding place actually contains loot so the players help Capt'n Sharky to find out where the gems are.

Players move their pirate pawns along the row of island tiles by playing one of six movement cards. The card hand is repleneished only after all cards have been played. Whenever a pirate lands on an empty tile he gets to place the treasure chest on the tile and opens it to checks whether he's found something. When all gems have been found, the player with the most gems is the winner.

A variant requires players to catapult the gems into the ship's hold in order to score them.

The island tiles and the treasure chest use magnets to make the chest display different symbols when it is placed on a tile.

This game is basically a smaller carry-along version of Capt'n Sharky: Abenteuer auf der Schatzinsel with a few differences in implementation.

149910.description:
Six Making, a.k.a. Sixth, is a two-player abstract strategy game in which players challenge each other in building chess figures. In this game, checkmating the opponent doesn't make you a winner; instead the goal is to build a king.

In more detail, players alternate in either placing one of their own pieces on the board as a chess pawn or moving any of the pieces on the board. Taking pieces results in building higher stacks, which move like different chess pieces. Even parts of stacks can be moved as their corresponding chess piece. The first player to create a stack of six or more pieces — with their own color on top — wins the game.
149910.name: Six Making

149911.name: ReMatch
149911.description:
ReMatch is a tactical strategy game for two or three players. Players fight a David and Goliath like battle with different armies. Combinatory skills, and anticipating the opponents’ movement will make the difference in this game.

The game is played on a small hex board. One side fights with 4 pieces, the other side with 8 pieces (4 each of two colors). The player with two colors must alternate between them. The pieces move and capture others as in checkers. Capturing is mandatory. The larger army must capture themselves and the smaller army has a special move.

The game ends when all pieces of one side have been captured or a player cannot move.

149912.name: Against the Grain (A Matter of Honor, Part 2)
149912.description:
website blurb:
After the summer solstice, Jakallans hunker down for the annual food riots. But this year, the clan has a special reason to protect its warehouse. It could be a long and bumpy week…

An adventure set in the world of the Empire of the Petal Throne, using the Gardásiyal rules. Sequel to A Matter of Honour; it is recommended, but not required, to have played that adventure. All materials provided. Beginners welcome, but this game features adult themes. This is not a monster-bash: strong roleplaying required.

from the Author's Introduction:
This adventure is designed as a follow-up to A Matter of Honour using the same characters. I don’t think this scenario would work as well without the conflicting goals of the group. If other characters are to be used, this scenario may lose a lot of tension without some Sarku worshippers and Dlamelish worshippers.

149914.name: A Matter of Honor
149914.description:
from the scenario introduction:
Originally published in the Eye of All Seeing Wonder #6, this version has been slightly modified to improve internal consistency.

from Notes for the Referee:
This adventure was designed for conventions, using the Gardásiyal rules, where it can introduce new players to Tékumel. It is set in Jakálla in late 2365, about a year after Dhich'une's acension to the Petal Throne, with all PCs members of the Clan of the White Crystal, an old and respected high status clan. The most common occupations for this clan are medium-level priests and bureaucrats. The scenario calls for two players who are experienced Tékumel hands, each assigned a so-called 'senior PC' character. These senior PCs are designed to be subtly opposed to one another during the game, and each has a secret to keep. Neither is intended to actually engage in heroics (In fact, one of them has no combat or sorcery skills): their role instead is to serve as sources of information for the other PCs, and to help move the plot along.

149915.description:
Game description from the publisher:

An ancient evil rises in Nerekhall, and each night heralds a series of sinister events. In Shadow of Nerekhall, the newest expansion for Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition), players try to determine whether outside forces are corrupting the city — or whether the city itself is rotten to the core. Shadow of Nerekhall introduces a riveting campaign, divided into nineteen quests filled with deadly monsters and traps. This expansion introduces four new heroes, four new classes, new quests, monsters, and more, as the heroes travel through the city, attempting to save it from the demonic creatures entering Nerekhall from the Black Realm.
149915.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Shadow of Nerekhall

104162.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)

149917.name: Euro-Express
149917.description:
In Euro-Express, players can create or expand nine speed rail connections with a total of 28 sections that are primarily links between the capitals of the European Community. Important regional sub-centers of some countries are also connected to the network. Existing train connections are shown on the schedule as rails.

The goal is to create a train through Europe, and only through team work can players hope to achieve this challenge. Each player takes the role of the Minister of Transport of the EC countries. In the EC, the ministers meet regularly in the Council of Ministers of Transport. The Common Community Commission proposes the construction of a particular route. The European Parliament may accept this proposal or reject it. This also applies to the Transport Ministers Council, which will decide after discussing the planning and financing of the track.

Any Minister of Transport can try to fund the project through national budgetary resources, which he can invest in the construction of the Euro-train. In addition, the Transport Ministers Council may fall back in the game on loans from the European Investment Bank (EIB) and funds from the EC transport budget.

Until all the capitals of the community are linked by the Euro-Express, the Council has to overcome many hurdles and crack many hard nuts.

149918.description:

Delta Green for Cthulhu Dark

149921.name: Temple of the Doomed Prince
149921.description:

An adventure for five to eight characters of 4th-6th level or RuneQuest characters of 45%-65% weapon skills, suitable for use as an Advanced Dungeons & Dragons scenario, a non-Gloranthan RuneQuest adventure or for Empire of the Petal Throne.

Note: This scenario was first published in White Dwarf issue 54 (June 1984.) Permission has been given by the author to publish on the web. The original title graphic has been reproduced because it’s such a wonderful example of early 80s typography!

149922.description:
Spider-Man and his allies make their long-awaited return to the Legendary Universe! Legendary: Paint The Town Red is a Small Box Expansion to the Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game.

5 new Heroes! 2 new Villain groups! 2 new Masterminds! 4 new Schemes!

The game will feature the long awaited appearance of Black Suit Spiderman as well as the evil Mastermind, Carnage. Each Small Box Expansion Set comes with 100 playable cards featuring all original art.

129437.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

149923.name: Zombie Stomp
149923.description:
Zombie Stomp is a stand-alone miniatures game of redneck-vs.-zombie combat that uses the ECS game engine developed by Team Frog Studios, the same system that powers Super-Powered Miniatures Combat as well as the SuperFogeys game.

Gameplay is fast and furious, with the players having the opportunity to run through large and complex scenarios in a single session that lasts two hours or less. This allows for less time setting up to play, and more time actually shooting stuff!

The rules are free-form enough that you can build whatever scenarios and situations you wish with them.

149927.name: LED: Lógica – Estrategia – Deducción
149927.description:
LED is a challenging strategic game where every game is unique.

Players must place their tiles closing different colored led circuits starting from a base tile.

For every closed circuit both the player and the color collect points. However, until the end of the game, each player color remains secret.

Only through a clever combination of strategy and bluff can a player claim victory in the end.


Es un desafiante juego de estrategia donde cada partida es única;

los jugadores deben ubicar sus baldosas sobre la mesa cerrando circuitos de leds de diferentes colores partiendo de una baldosa base.

Por cada circuito cerrado acumula puntos el jugador y el color, este último es secreto.

Hasta que el juego termina no se conoce el ganador!

149931.name: Majus
149931.description:
publisher blurb:
MAJUS

YOU MANIPULATE FROM THE SHADOWS

BUT EVEN THE SHADOWS HAVE MASTERS

You are a sorcerer who can trace his ancestral roots to the Sumerian sorcerer-priests who wielded vast power. You are an inheritor of the magical bloodline enmeshed in a conspiracy dating from before human civilization. Battle against enemies in the Old Game, to harness the secrets of the mysterious Skein. You may be a member of a competing Tower, an association or cabal of like-minded Maji, or a renegade with your own motivations.

MAJUS is a magic noir role-playing game complete in one volume.

These rules contain:

Rules for character generation

A complete magic system compatible with other Pacesetter games

Guidelines for playing campaigns in a magic noir world

Supernatural enemies

...and more!

from Chapter 1: Initiation:

MAJUS is a game of conspiracy,deceit, and high weirdness set in the modern era. The Maji are not lightning-throwing superheroes, blasting one another in the middle of Times Square, or demi-gods that soar through the stratosphere. Instead, they are consummate gamesmen engaged in a daily contest of wills, intelligence, and, above all, magic to advance their own goals. In the world of MAJUS, secrecy is paramount and the best victory is winning a contest your enemy never even knew he was participating in.

149932.name: Reiter der schwarzen Sonne
149932.description:
User Summary:

Reiter der schwarzen Sonne is a massive German gamebook by Swen Harder that sports over 1350 sections. The book won a RPC Fantasy Jury Award 2013.

Publisher Blurb:

Du bist ein Ugarith, ein Meister der Nacht, der ohne Erinnerung an Herkunft und Vergangenheit nach der Ausübung einer ver­hängnisvollen Bluttat erwacht. Geächtet und verfolgt musst du dir fortan den Weg in die Freiheit erkämpfen, deine über­menschlichen Kräfte ergründen, um schließlich deine heilige Pflicht - die Begradigung des Weltenflusses - zu erfüllen...

Ob das Schicksal des Ugarith zu einem glücklichen, neutralen oder düsteren Ende gelangt, hängt jedoch einzig von deinen Entscheidungen ab - denn dies ist kein gewöhnlicher Roman, sondern ein Fantasy-Spielbuch!

Reiter der schwarzen Sonne ist mit mehr als 1.350 Sektionen das größte jemals veröffentlichte Spielbuch und setzt durch seinen innovativen Umgang mit Sektionsverweisen und hohen Wieder­spielwert neue Maßstäbe für das Genre. Besonders charakteristisch sind das Finden versteckter Bonussektionen, Endgegnerkämpfe im eigenen, ausführlichen Kampfkapitel und das Lösen komplexer Rätsel.

User Translation from German:

You're an Ugarith, a master of the night, waking up with no memory of your origin and history after causing a terrible bloodbath. Outlawed and persecuted you have to fight for yourself and your freedom, explore your superhuman powers, and finally fulfil your sacred duty: the straightening of the world river...

Whether the fate of the Ugarith comes to a happy, neutral or dark end, however, depends only on your decisions - because this is no ordinary novel, but a fantasy gamebook!

Reiter der schwarzen Sonne (Rider of the Black Sun) is the biggest gamebook ever published with more than 1,350 sections, and by its innovative use of section references and high replay value it sets new standards for the genre. Especially characteristic are hidden bonus sections, boss battles in its own extensive combat chapter, and solving complex puzzles.

149933.name: Die Geheimnisse von Reiter der schwarzen Sonne
149933.description:
User Summary:

Die Geheimnisse von Reiter der schwarzen Sonne provides background information on the creation of Reiter der schwarzen Sonne, help with some of the riddles, and the process of illustrating the gamebook.

The booklet is part of the special edition, but also available separately.

149934.name: 32 Suspects
149934.description:
Quoted from the rulebook: Policemen have to catch a disguised thief. Whoever wins the largest number of medals becomes the best policeman. Policemen can jointly investigate in catching a thief and they can win and share more medals,

In each round one player is the thief and the other players are the policemen. The thief draws one thief card (from 32) and the policemen have to find out that card.

In turn, the policeman turn over 4 cards from the suspect deck, which consists of the same cards as in the thief deck. Then they ask a closed question (yes/no) about a feature of the thief, like baldness, wearing a beard, wearing glasses, having a red jacket etc., which the thief has to answer. After that, the thief is allowed to turn over one face-up card.

After six questions the remaining cards are turned face up. Now the policemen have to point to the suspect, they think suspect being the thief. If all policemen guess correctly, they get a number of medals that is printed on the thief card. If they point to different suspects, only the correct guessing policemen gain 1 medal. If all policemen fail with their guesses, they all lose one medal.
The game ends when each player was the thief once. The player with the most medals wins. Ties are possible...

149935.name: Larps from the Factory
149935.description:
From the Introduction:

What you have in your hand is all the Larp Factory larpscripts we were able to fit into a book. You also can find supporting material - including game materials such as character sheets and hand outs, as well as video of all the workshop and meta-techniques used - on the supporting website larpsfromthefactory.com.

The Larp Factory games are based on a philosophy that they should be easy to participate in. This means that they are relatively short - between three and eight hours - and that they demand no preparations from the players. This doesn't mean that you can't let your players prepare, but it should be possible to sign up the same day and have an equally good experience. Traditionally, these games have been quite cheap for the participants, as only a few require extensive scenography and props.

Although they are easy to participate in, they are not necessarily easy to run. In the fact box of each larp you can see the level of difficulty, from very easy games that you can run right here right now with the people on hand, to logistically difficult scenarios that require extensive scenography and lighting.

How to use this book

The larpscripts in the book - and the videos - and cheat sheets on the web page are designed to make it as easy as possible for you to run the workshops, games and debriefs.

The larpscripts explain the premise of each game and how to run it. Each script contains an introduction and fact box to help you decide whether this is the right game for you.

The larpscripts are designed to be used in conjunction with the website.

- Second Wave: triggers an additional zombie attack in one area.

149936.name: City of Horror: Director's Cut

149937.name: Camp Wic4kini (Aether)
149937.description:
From publisher blurb:

You weren't expecting the head of the Kinzey Foundation to contact you for a job. Everyone knows they are into some heavy stuff, that the Foundation building parks is just their public face. After the meeting, you're just as confused as you were before. It just doesn't make any sense. You're supposed to go up to some summer camp and kidnap some Native guy, but you've got some really nasty equipment that you're taking with you; some sort of freeze gun and some suspicious device that is supposed to keep animals at bay.

None of this makes sense, but the pay is good, and the chance to work with the Kinzey's more in the future is way worth it.

Or so you thought. You have never been so wrong in all your life.

Inside this adventure you'll find:

The final adventure at Camp Wicakini
8 Pre-generated Characters for quick play
Maps for all of the camp buildings provided by Fabled Environments
Rules for what happens when the PCs turn to zombies
New gear!
